Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jacnit
Reviews.Content: Well, personally I love this place. You do have to beg for an upgrade, beg for an early check-in, asked for an extra chair for the room and was told "we don't have any extra chairs in the hotel"..really??? now I doubt you don't have one extra chair but hey, overall I did get an upgrade to a king corner that was breathtaking in view!! The rooms are awesome..a total NYC experience. The only downside was this morning...$5.00 for a cup of coffee in a paper cup...COME ON!!!!!!!!!!...I know, I know..i'm in ny but really?? you can't throw in at least one coffee to get your guests up and going? Well, there are tons of coffee shops right around the corner so I'd say stay here but get your joe elsewhere!! All in all I'll be back..loved it & i did get my early check in:) one more suggestion..do not walk in and plop down on the beds..these beds are hard as a brick..I mean, NO give..but surprisingly I slept well and no aches or pains when I woke up!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: goodingrid
Reviews.Content: Its not cheap but great rooms, great view, lovely sheets/beds, great shower...really polite & helpful staff. had a double deluxe room for 6 nights in end february early march. really really great location, everything is walking distance. only criticism i would have was the girl who checked us in was very unclear about the $25 dollar voucher that came as part of the package we booked so we didnt end up using it, bit annoying.... the internet, complimentary with our room, was also intermittent so i wouldnt recommend for a business trip, we stayed for 6 nights and each day i had an elaborate re-log in with special passcode etc. oh yeah and lifts are crazy slow for some reason so give yourself time if you're heading out somewhere Over all though we'd a fantastic visit, slept really well, i didnt find it noisy at all (some reviewers seem to) & i'll without question stay there again

Reviews.Title: “return trip to Thompson LES even better”
Reviews.Author: Fun2Travel13
Reviews.Content: We went for a visit to NYC for the weekend (Feb 24th-Feb 26th) this year and enjoyed our return trip to the Thompson LES. It was very convenient to my friend's place in the East Village. We checked in late Friday night and the front desk receptionist was very friendly. My young daughter made an instant friend. The hotel staff accommodated our request for a quiet room and gave us a corner room (2 beds) with a view of the pool (closed for the season) on the quiet side of the hotel. Having stayed at the hotel before, I wasn't surprised to find the darker room due to the dark wood furnishings. Once we figured out which light switches turned on the respective lights, the room wasn't so dark. Here is a list of pros and cons of the hotel. Pros: 1) Friendly and courteous staff. We did not have to wait for our room to become available and worked with a very friendly and capable receptionist. The bellhops/front door security men were pleasant and made sure to accommodate all our needs during the stay. 2) Comfortable beds and extra pillows. I like to sleep with extra pillows and did not have to request more at this hotel. 3) Shower was awesome! My daughter loved the rain shower and the small handheld attachment that was just at her height so she could enjoy her own little shower. The layout was a little unique since the shower was next to the bed and the frosted glass allowed her to "see" someone in the shower. The shower in this room was huge and could accommodate 3 people if needed :) 4) Close to many areas of NYC. We walked to little Italy/NoLita and had croissants at Ceci-Cela (great almond croissants and service). We also took a stroll towards Chinatown and stopped to get donuts at Doughnut Plant on Grand and bagels next door (I love NYC bagels). We took the subway to FAO Schwarz (my daughter's favorite part of the trip) and was easy to navigate from the hotel. 5) On-site gym. My husband used the gym and stated it wasn't crowded and adequately equipped. Cons: The only reason I gave the rating a 4 instead of 5 was the toilet handle in the bathroom was coming off. We could still flush the toilet but it took some steps to make sure the handle didn't come off completely. I'm surprised the housecleaning staff did not notice this when preparing the room for the guests. Also, internet was not free (not a big deal but still annoying). Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “good but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: alberto c
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really good, the view from the rooms is great but air condition doesn't work an it's very noisy, the lifts are soo slow and never show up (it takes 10 min to get one). It's new york city, I know, but for 400$ I would expect more service. So, I suggest the hotel of course, but only with reasonable fee.

Reviews.Title: “not really a boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Massimo T
Reviews.Content: Well located in NYC and this to my own criteria of valuation is the only plus of the hotel. It is presented as a boutique hotel and priced accordingly but i don't think the boutique hotel description match with the service and with the rooms size and decoration. In a boutique hotel i expect a minimum of personalized service, starting from the welcome at the reception, perhaps few information about the area and the facilities of the hotel, this is not the case when you arrive in this hotel. The porter was the only one who did smile once. I booked a smoking room but to get an ashtray in the room i had to call the reception the first day and the second day as well. There is no way you can let her fresh air flow into the room because windows and glass door are blocked. The ac system is noisy and unefficient. The decoration of the room is absolutely standard, nothing which i could define special including the choice of linen and towels of pretty average quality. The first morning we had breakfast in the hotel, pretty poor quality food and extremely highly priced served on very uncomfortable low table. The only positive note goes to the attendant of Greek nationality, the kindest staff of the hotel. (Look for Pulino's bar close by if you like to enjoy an extremely good and fairly priced breakfast!) wifi is not free of charge like in most of the hotel of the same category, a bottle of water is charged 10 usd and you have to double check is the bottle is sealed and not re-filled with tap water. so in general very little attention of details in a town like new york where look and style is so relevant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but average service”
Reviews.Author: btorreparis
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location as the saying goes for real estate. This hotel is perfectly situated in downtown NYC, close to East village, Nolita and Soho and right off the LES bar scene. But for hte rest, nothing out of the extraordinary. I booked a king deluxe room @ 300usd/night and even at this price range you will not get much higher than the 5th floor, with a very limited view of NYC skyline, which is the biggest selling point of the hotel. Strangely, the girl at the hotel skipped by free breakfasts and I had to get back to the front desk to get it settled. And last but not least a mistake on my bill was showing 3 items from the minibar that I did not consume. So make sure you check your bill. This is below par 4 star hotel service level. I probably will not stay again @ this location.

Reviews.Title: “Small, dark, concrete boxes”
Reviews.Author: EuropeTraveler3400
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine..but not great. The rooms are dark and the ceilings are concrete, which might appeal to some, but just feels cold to me. Service is prompt. No restaurant on site, but there is a bar with average food/drink.

Reviews.Title: “I would give it 3 1/2 starts if possible--good, but I was hoping for more”
Reviews.Author: rmeehan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made a last minute reservation at this hotel and snagged a great rate. The location is prime and the rate was good...and we were staying during the week in March, so the place was pretty quiet. The staff offered us an upgrade to a suite with a great view and a patio for a few more dollars, but when we went to the room it had clearly been smoked in (despite the fact it was a non-smoking room) and we declined (ALL hotels should be 100% non-smoking). The room we ended up with was fine, although my wife observed that the hotel tried too hard to be European. If you've been to a typical European hotel you know their beds don't have sheets and blankets like American hotels but instead have a single comforter thing. I dislike it in Europe and I dislike it more in the US. The room was drafty, too, so we had to keep the heat cranked to stay warm. The lighting situation in the room was abysmal...why do so many modern hotels have ridiculous lighting?? I still think the room was too dark and am still baffled by the crazy light switches. The bar was ok, but the bar staff was not the least bit friendly. About 25 minutes after we arrived the waiter told us he was leaving so we'd have to close out our tab (which is waiter speak for "I'd really like my tip now, please") and that kinda soured the experience. The fire alarm went off at approx 04:45 AM (There is no way any human would have slept through this alarm) and I feel the staff could have done a better job of informing the guests that it was a false alarm. They slipped a very nice note apologizing for the alarm under our doors a few hours later that morning, but at the time I really would have like to have known if I was supposed to evacuate or not. IF you do stay here, I highly recommend a walk West on Houston for a few blocks till you come across the Bowery Cafe on the south side of the street. The coffee is phenomenal and the Almond Croissant is one of the best baked goods I have ever consumed.

Reviews.Title: “Almost great, but not quite!”
Reviews.Author: jayester74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a business trip during New York Fashion Week. There are a few plus-es about this place, but more minuses at the moment sadly. Nice that i got a room upgrade to a suite, not so nice that there isn't a proper restaurant in the hotel! Had a bad experience when tried to use the bar which the staff had recommended to me for its great cocktails - it was shut for a private event, and we were rudely asked to vacate. Not cool at all! My television didn't work for two days, again not great - and one night i was kept up til 5am with a party in the room next to mine, and the hotel staff were reluctant to shut it down. I did indeed wonder if i was staying in a nightclub or a hotel! Also, the deep downtown location means you're quite far from the main attractions of NYC. All in all, i can see potential in this hotel, but at the moment, they definitely are not living up to the high standards of other Thompson hotel properties.

Reviews.Title: “is it a club or a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: neige8
Reviews.Content: The LES Thompson needs to decide if it wants to be a club or a hotel. We stayed here for 5 nights. During the week everything was great but on the weekend the club kicked off and we could not get to sleep until after 3am in the morning. We were on the 10 floor and thought the noise would not affect us because the club was on a much lower floor, but we were wrong. If it wants to be club - I would give the sound system 5 stars - but unfortunately we thought we were checking into a hotel. We loved the neighborhood (surrounded by unique shops and restaurants), the rooms were sleek and modern, the staff were all really nice and the rate was great for NY. For the first few days we had thought we had found a gem - but then the weekend came.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: AssiaMoretti
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at LES for a long weekend getaway. Absolutely loved the service and staff in the hotel, very helpful and has a great location! Normally I stay closer to midtown when travelling to NYC but this location was perfect. and the concierge recommended alot of neat places in walking distance. The rooms were great and the lounge on the 7th floor was alot of fun. I look forward to staying there again. Â

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property and Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: jrondadon
Reviews.Content: I don't really like to post my experience (good or bad) because I don't get the time to do so... i'm always on the run and never in a place with good internet connection (talk about 3rd world countries). But here i was in New York for a good week and was visiting my cousins from Calgary. We decided to meet up in NY since it's been 3 years since I came here... We decided to stay in the lower east side area because it was hip and happening from all the TimeOut reviews and articles that i had researched from back home. This is another reason i don't like to write reviews because i'm too detailed and could end up here for an hour. Yes, the reason i'm writing is because i do see a lot of reviews on Thompson LES and some are good and some are okay and some just outrageous (i don't know if these are true)... But let me state my side of the story and how it was so satisfying and just left me breathless from the first day to our check-out. We stayed in one of those Studio Kings on the 8th floor which was quite high but the view was not what i was looking for. Anyways, i didn't come here to stay in my room, i was here for my cousins and our good time in NY. During our stay, the staff at the front desk was more than giving, extremely courteous and very attractive i should say... They never said no to anything but came up with some suggestions all the time ... very young staff but i could tell they were in to it... Very cool and not up tight as other standard Hilton's and the Marriotts that we are used to... I was disappointed that they didn't have a restaurant but the front desk staff introduced us to Meatball shop and other neighborhood restaurants which were sooo good... Besides, all that the manager on duty during check-out actually invited me back to the hotel on my next trip to NY and said he'll buy me a drink or two in the new restaurant that they were opening. I will definitely be back just because of that gesture and involvement in his guest when i mentioned about the restaurant absence. that was my only complaint (so to speak).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay for what we thought was going to be special hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Aileen B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Thompson Hotel from 2nd Feb. to the 7th Feb. 2012 and we were very disappointed to say the least. We are regular visitors to Manhattan as I have family there and decided to head downtown as we normally stay in midtown. So we choose what we thought was a trendy, modern hotel with cool hang out areas, bars and restuarants!!! Oh how wrong we were, I arrived to meet my friend who had already arrived and she told me she was on the 7th floor terrace bar, I said who...hoo and headed up to meet her. The "bar" is really only a terrace/deck with worn material on the not at all comfy or cosy couches, no atmosphere and served me my long awaited Grey Goose/Tonic in a plastic long glass....I was paying a good deal of money and I got my drink in a plastic glass, was I back at my festival days...So we then asked where the "real" bar and trendy restaurant that we had read about on the website when we booked the hotel were to be told "oh we are sorry but they are closed as we are changing mgmt companies"....Needless to say we were annoyed, we only booked the room a couple of weeks ago and we booked based on photos we saw of the hotel amenities on the internet, but we could not find the places that matched there nice pictures in the hotel, we should have been notified about this at booking time...OK granted the room was very good, really spacious, comfy beds and lovely sheets....But it ended there....There was always about 8 staff in the lobby to any guest so it wasn't exactly the type of lobby you wanted to hang around, as you felt eyes on you all the time...Overall we were so disappointed at this quite high priced hotel and I expressed our disappointment on our last day when we were checking out and really the response we received drove me to write this review, it was an indifferent response, and I just thought...thats it I'm writing this review....so my advice don't stay in this hotel, unless they can guarantee everything you see in the photos is actually there for you during your stay...:)

Reviews.Title: “The Thompson experience at bargain rates”
Reviews.Author: oibarra3
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at this property, and enjoyed the stay. The property is very well kept, has great ambiance, you will enjoy the modern design around the common areas as well as in the guest rooms. Very helpful courteous staff, great location, within walking distance to Soho!

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel in Lower East Side”
Reviews.Author: Putt4Doe
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal using the Hotel Tonight app. Really enjoyed the property - definitely is an ultra-modern hip hotel. If you only stay at Marriotts or Starwood hotels, you will likely not "get" this place. Likely a bit of a lifestyle shock. Else, I highly recommend as the customer service was excellent and enjoyed the great location to walk to SoHo in minutes. Definitely will be back my next time in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy A
Reviews.Content: So we had originally booked a 2 night stay at the thompson lower east sides, but due to unforeseen circumstances, the guests did not check out of the room so they were forced to send us over to Smyth. The way the front office staff handled us was incredible, they gave us money for a cab ride to Smyth, also tells us that we don't need to worry our luggage and just get on with our day, cause they will send it over to Thompson LES the next day. When we checked into Thompson after roaming around the city, our bags were already in our room and we were upgraded to a studio king suite. When we checked out, we only had to pay for a one night stay. Talk about customer service! Pros: excellent customer service, beautiful view of sunrise, in the soho area - great for partying and shopping Cons: the lighting is a little bit more on the dark side. wish there was more chairs for tanning by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice. Amazing Service.”
Reviews.Author: William E
Reviews.Content: Let me just say from inside and out the Thompson Les is "Perfect". I arrived during the night and was welcomed by the bellman who kindly took my bags without hesitation. Upon check-in I was greeted by the front desk and manager. Check-in process was informative and easy. The room was spacious and beautiful, especially after my room was service. Their bar/lounge was pretty good/loud as well, a bit slow on drink service but good nonetheless. I would defiantly stay here again and highly recommend to those who need astounding service and superb rooms. Special thanks to Justyna, Miguel, and Michael!! Made my stay memorable! (Always have 8 1/2 playing at the hotel, should I be expecting a change in movie next visit?)

Reviews.Title: “Modern great view”
Reviews.Author: KLA59
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to soho & lower east side. Definitely aimed at younger crowd. Room was good, floor to ceiling windows with great wires of lower east side.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown option”
Reviews.Author: lcsmd
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms - king and king suite. Suite was fantastic, spacious, nice products- regular room was pretty tight but decent. Service was spotty, mostly related to front desk (30 mins to check in and also to check out!) and then valet gave us the wrong car...location is great- overall a positive impression...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location in Soho.”
Reviews.Author: JRobinson_52
Reviews.Content: LIked everything about the Thompson LES. Do wish they had a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Style in a great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: mactlc
Reviews.Content: Even before we arrived, we'd had friendly service via email. We upgraded to a King room and then concierge recommended restaurants based on our likes and booked them all for us. When we arrived the service was fantastic, we were up on the 15th floor, the room was very sleek and spacious, but the view was AMAZING! We were on a corner, so one side had views downtown and Brooklyn Bridge, the other side looked uptown with fantastic views of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings. The concierge were incredibly helpful, friendly and knowledgeable, in fact all of the staff were great. We went to the club on 7th floor once and made a swift exit - it was just too loud and achingly hip for this once hard clubbing Londoner! The restaurant/bar was hit and miss to be honest. We only went there for the odd drink before going out/coming back and either had to wait an age to be served, or kept being served the wrong drink! This was resolved with the restaurant manager at the time, but I have to say there are so many fabulous bars and restaurants in New York, that it didn't spoil our experience and all the great points of this hotel would far outweigh the less positive. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury in Downtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Morgan B
Reviews.Content: A fantastic mix of modern luxury and New York sophistication. The Thompson LES is positioned in a fantastic location if you are looking for SoHo shopping, or Lower East Side nightlife. This sleek hotel is very well priced for the service, style and location.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist in all ways”
Reviews.Author: Devo18
Reviews.Content: The Thompson LES is minimalist in all ways--decor, vibe, and service. The front desk staff was rather frosty when I checked in (even though I was wearing all black!) for one night on business. My room had a great king-sized bed, but the all-black bathroom and walls were so dark that I couldn't see the dip in the floor that separated the bathroom from the main bedroom, and kept inadvertently tripping on it. Hotel has a definite hipster vibe, but that includes an unwelcoming lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: BFB62
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a friend and unfortunately only stayed for 1 night but the hotel is very cool and in a great location, staff are friendly but not overly so. The Kiel's bathroom amenities are a great choice. Internet connection is terrible though and I think they know it because as soon as I mentioned that I had paid to connect and still couldnt download emails they took it right off the bill. Would definitely recommend the hotel for anyone wanting to be LES.

Reviews.Title: “Hipster cool over charm”
Reviews.Author: daenalus
Reviews.Content: The service was pleasant and unintrusive, the room clean and well-appointed. The hotelâ€™s much-touted design, however, is abrasive and unsettling. The rooms feature polished concrete ceilings, black wood floors and in the bathroom, floor-to-ceiling black stone. The effect of all this black and concrete, particularly when in the narrow toilet, is to make one feel as though they have been incarcerated. The lightbox headboard is neat but underwhelming. The platform bed is fairly stiff. In all, the hotelâ€™s design and architecture are of the worst sort: it makes no effort to respond to what a person looks for in a dwelling but rather tries to contain you within its notions of downtown hipster cool. The building, from the outside, is representative. The grey and black tower looms over the brick-tenement dominated neighborhood. Really, they could stage Beckett plays in these rooms. I was booked here for business. I will next time inquire at the Bowery Hotel, which appears to have a bit more charm.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Calvinsmom11
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms, friendly staff and reasonably priced. I love the LES !!

Reviews.Title: “New York vacation at the Thompson LES”
Reviews.Author: tesuquevalley
Reviews.Content: We travel to New York several times a year from Los Angeles and usually stay mid-town. I had heard about the Thompson LES and decided to try it. The location is within walking distance of all the great shops and restaurants in Soho. The energy of the area is fantastic. We were lucky to stay in a one bedroom suite. The suite is beautiful, dark wood floors, spectacular bedroom with a beautifully backlit headboard, living area was spacious and well appointed. The room is very quiet. The bathroom is oversized, beautifully appointed with a spa-like feel and Kiehl products. The staff was very friendly, very helpful but never invasive. Thompson LES was a great home-base for our New York adventure.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind sleeping in a club then choose this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rubyyao
Reviews.Content: The location is 'central' but the neighborhood is ugly, period. It's a dump really. Rooms are small. Extremely noisy. Last call at the club is 2.45 am so don't expect to sleep earlier than that. There is no housekeeping as such, just one person working as a bell man, room service, house keeping so dont expect to have anything done in timely manner. Bring your own shower cap, slippers etc because you need to ask for them. I asked for a blanket but it looks so dirty. I usually stay at the best hotels in the world so perhaps my standard is high. This is probably one of the worst hotel I have stayed at. Saff is nice but that was it. HORRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around, things are getting better.”
Reviews.Author: spbyrne
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Thompson LES this year. The first time I visited (see my review) I was solo, staying in a front facing room for just under a week and it really wasn't what I hoped it be. Upon an invitation to return, let's say the place has picked up in the months since I was last there. This time around I was visiting with family (albeit for the night) and found there had been some decorating in the lobby (a little more ambience). After suffering an abysmal and much delayed none hour flight via American Airlines flight from Dallas (O, I should have known) we were all very keen to get to bed because of the late hour. When we checked in we were assured the requested crib was in the room but no it wasn't and when one of the completely helpful staff turned up with it, he couldn't assemble it. No matter, we had our own portacrib and our son was in bed in minutes. This really was the only blemish on the Thompson's service and friendly staff. The room was of great quality and thankfully to the rear of the building. One thought, perhaps Fellini's La Dolce Vita playing on the elevator screen could be given a rest.

Reviews.Title: “We loooove Thompson LES”
Reviews.Author: malene b
Reviews.Content: We wanna go back to Thompson LES as soon as possible. We loved staying in this super cool (but super warm because of the best staff). Very good service, very nice people working all over in the hotel, super pro and very likeable staffl. Best area. First avenue, first street! Nice rooms, fantastic views with on both sides of the building with the nice big windows. Dear Thompson LES you really have a loveable hotel. Thank you for a fantastic stay. We really want to come back to visit you and of course stay with you as soon as possible. Love from Copenhagen

Reviews.Title: “Can't find your reservation but we are still going to try to charge you twice.”
Reviews.Author: parkerc1
Reviews.Content: When I attempted to check-in, the hotel could not locate my reservation. Fortunately they were not at full occupancy. I had my confirmation printed out and gave it to them. Still no luck. They created a new reservation and we were soon in our room. Well, after returning home, I saw there were two charges from the hotel. One was my total I signed for at check out, the other ($460.00) was unknown. When I called to inquire, a front desk rep told me it was a 'no show' charge, and they had a 'strict' no show policy. When I was explaining the confusing at my check-in, she interrupted me and said there was nothing she could do. So the computer obviously located my original reservation and flagged it as a no show. I finally spoke to a manager and he credited the money back. Complete idiots manning the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: polo10
Reviews.Content: Hip hotel with great friendly staff. AC in our room did not work properly. Management was more than helpful in resolving issue. Hip vibe, very dark hallways, no full length mirror in room. Comfortable beds. Great location.Solid 3 1/2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and cool”
Reviews.Author: Gdavidson
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to New York. I'd have never thought to stay in the Lower East Side, however, the location made for a unique and memorable NYC experience. I loved it. There is also a most remarkable music venue right next door (don't worry - there is NO noise into the hotel!!) Roof top pool to cool off in the Summer - how cool is that!! The rooms are great. The service is great. The location is great. What else is there?

Reviews.Title: “Sexiest hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: CindyH38
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this fab hotel based on other reviews of it's downtown location. Only had to take a taxi once during our stay, as soooo much is within walking distance: great restaurants, fun shops, the music hall right next door. Since it wasn't our first time visiting NYC, we really appreciated the local flavor of the neighborhood rather than touristy Mid-town. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and ready to chat it up if you wanted...or not. The room is clean, the decor so sexy, and it's HUGE compared to most in NYC and, oh! the rain shower is to die for! I told my husband that we need to remodel our bath to replicate this one. Stay here! You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice service”
Reviews.Author: freddy_wiesel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one week at the hotel and I must say that I have rarely found a hotel with nicer service personnel. They were all very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and reasonable big. However, if you plan to stay at Thompson LES, make sure that your room is NOT located at the 7th floor, as there is a bar opposite the rooms where parties take place on Thursdays to Saturdays. As there is no proper airlock, the noise from the bar kept us from sleeping. After complaining, we were offered another room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jetrun4327
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the thompson les this weekend, it was perfect. We requested a top floor quiet room and it was, all of the rooms are grouped by two down a separate hallway off the main hallway with a door that closes for extra quiet. The room had floor to ceiling windows with views of the lower east side and the williamsburg bridge. The bed was comfortable, big flat screen in the room and great mood lighting. Bathroom was spacious and had a rainfall shower. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The elevators show old movies on flat screens. There is a great coffee shop 2 doors up and a 24 hour bakery with amazing cheesecake called Sugar 2 doors down on Allen St. We had drinks at the rooftop hotel bar, Above Allen our first night with a lively crowd. The weather was in the 80s all weekend and the pool was open, although we didnt use it. Location is central, right across the street from the 2nd ave subway stop, but our favorite night going out was in the neighborhood around the hotel, lots of great restaurants and bars. Had the best time at the french diner across from the hotel, and everything is open all night, its nyc!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dark rooms, good times!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzynik
Reviews.Content: Overall, great location. Rooms are small(as our almost all of NYC, unless you stay at a freaking chain) and very dark. They should have more lighting, I mean hello, you don't have to turn on all the lights. Found the staff 'Wonderful' and oh so very accommodating. Things might run a wee bit slow here, but definitely will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Employees”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 5 night stay at the Thompson LES. Each and every employee was very friendly, helpful, polite, and learned/used my name each time they saw me. It was a very enjoyable place to stay - one I will go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, loved the mid-century modern decor!”
Reviews.Author: JauntingJK1
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a convenient and friendly boutique hotel in the city, the Thompson LES is a great choice. I first discovered hotel through jetsetter.com . I needed to book a hotel room for three guests and had trouble finding a space sizable enough to accommodate the request. The Thompson was one of the only luxury hotels that were able to fulfill this requirement, fall into my budget and still be in close proximity to Soho. We booked the King suite that also came with a pull-out queen sofa bed. Be sure to check out the Andy Warhol rooftop pool and second floor lounging area, decked out in mid-century modern furniture. The staff are always ready to help with any questions or recommendations. Loved the Sugar Cafe on the corner of Allen and Houston for some late night grub as well. Overall, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “3rd time !”
Reviews.Author: doublejStockholm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the LES for the third time in 3 years. Love the area and the atmosphere at the hotel is very relaxed. Got a nice upgrade to a King Suite with a "balcony" thanks ! Great rooms and a "glass bathroom". Pre-ordered a bottle of Prosecco, but got a bottle of Cava ! Good thing we are not Italian, that would have been a reason for war ;-). Hotel is starting to show some wear, but thats to expect after three years. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Best thing going in the LES”
Reviews.Author: ccrider55
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! Modern, beautiful rooms and a pool you want to lounge by. Nice staff too. My only complaint: WiFi is $15 per day. Really? Go outside the door to any nearby hotspot instead.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: jeffbb2
Reviews.Content: I went to the Thompson LES hotel with my girlfriend for a "stay-cation." We live in NYC and I wanted a romantic two nights in a hotel as a nice little getaway from home. I told the staff at the Thompson what I had planned and they were great! They upgraded our room and sent us a half bottle of Champagne. I thought the rooms were very nice and the pool/bar was nice too. We didn't have a chance to check out the restaurant but everything else was beautiful. If you are looking for a cool/hip Downtown NYC experience this is the place to be. It has a modern and artistic touch. If you want an old-style "grand" hotel, then you will have better luck in midtown. The Thompson LES is more of a cute GEM of a hotel and it was exactly what were looking for, and we wanted to be downtown so it was perfect. Everything was clean as can be and the staff was top-notch. What else can I say but thanks to Thompson LES staff for a great "Stay-cation."

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StaceyinVa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night at the hotel with our family. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were modern and very comfortable. The pool was great and not expected for a NYC hotel. It was in a great location for restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Service is a major let down”
Reviews.Author: Quandos
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice, rooms are nice, facilities are nice. What lets this place down is the service. They say they'll do something and never do. They forgot to give you fresh towels, you call to request at LEST 3 TIMES before someone "remembers" same with turn down services, packages delivered to the hotel and so on. You ask they forgot and you have to keep reminding them until you feel like a nagging grandma. Not what I'd expect at all. It's a shame because the staff are very nice and welcoming. Hard to sleep because of bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel Without The Attitude”
Reviews.Author: testarossa313
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend was playing at a major music festival this past weekend, so we were put up here. The staff were wonderful - super friendly and accommodating (and they brought cookies to us shortly after we got settled!). We had a lovely queen room on the 16th floor, facing west (so I got to watch the absolutely gorgeous sunset!). The bathroom had an oversized rain showerhead, which was awesome. And, as other people have noted, there's some really cool artwork in the room. There's a minibar as well as a drawer stocked with snacks and other 'essentials,' but there are also several eating and drinking options all around the hotel (and open late, too - we can back at 5am and there was a bakery right below the hotel that was still open). As someone who prefers a softer mattress, my least favourite aspect of the room was the firmer-feeling mattress in the room, but honestly we both slept like rocks so it wasn't a big deal! The train is 2 blocks away or if you're not really the public transportation type, the staff are more than happy to hail a cab for you. We were really happy with this place and I can definitely recommend it if you're looking for something off the beaten path of traditional hotel chains :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice presentation- service could have been better”
Reviews.Author: lfigel
Reviews.Content: Overall, one of the nicest (and most unique) properties I've stayed at in NYC. The service could have been better. Our room wasn't ready until 7pm...which is kind of ridiculous, considering their check-in time was probably around 3pm. We also made a few requests which we had to call and remind the front desk of after they didn't follow through. The room, however, we very clean and the presentation of the hotel in general is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hostess”
Reviews.Author: Jobee93
Reviews.Content: I just want to mention how impressed I was with the hostess at the beautiful bar in the Thompson LES. I had just ordered something but discovered I had to leave before the order came out. When I told her that I had to leave and would pay for my order, she told me that she'd just cancel it. No attitude, no problem. I think it was a very classy thing to do. Kudos to her. I wish I had gotten her name. This happened on Thursday afternoon, August 25, 2011 at about 7:30 pm. (My friends were the hotel guests. I was waiting in the bar for them).

Reviews.Title: “elegant slice of lower east side”
Reviews.Author: GGGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Love this place, is swishy, looks fine, fantastic service, excellent restaurant and bars. Have stayed a few times now, and always enjoyed it. I like the hotel on Rivington also, but the Thompson just feels that a little more elegant, and definitely more peaceful. Decent room sizes for NY, great views from the upper floors. Its a lovely retreat from the lower east side chaos when you've had enough.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with alot of style and character”
Reviews.Author: colin_morrissey
Reviews.Content: Where do I start, i came here for my anniversary , upon arrival i was upgraded to a deluxe room with an amazing view of the empire state building, brooklyn bridge and New York. Staff were very friendly and helpful and hotel pool was a nice extra to cool down in the afternoon. Rooms- We stayed in room 1200 and had a huge balcony and breathtaking views. The room had all the modern things , iphone docs , alarms , widescreen tv, kool shower and very comfortable beds. My friend who lives in New York came to see our room , was amazed and is now recommending to her friends also. Area - The hotel is based beside the subway in a really kool and hip area with a wide variety of foods , from Ethiopian, to Italian etc. Good value to be had and more authenic than some of the other parts of Manhattan. I would definately stay again and recommend to anyone but make sure you get a deluxe room , worth the extra few dollars !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Thompson LES”
Reviews.Author: jessBoston78
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with some of the most pleasant and friendly staff I have seen in quite some time. We asked for a high floor and were booked into a room on the 17th floor with a wrap around balcony with amazing views of the city. The design of the rooms are very cool with black wooden floors, a concrete ceiling and amazing linen. They have a pool on the third floor which was perfect for some cocktails, the bar on the 7th floor was closed during my stay. Thank you Thompson LES I had a fabulous stay and will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a hip neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter1949
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I shared a king studio suite for three nights and were very satisfied with this hotel and our overall experience there. First, we snagged one of the better summer deals going -- king studio suite plus full breakfast for two for an average of $310 per night. Staff was very friendly and efficient. A/C was mercifully effective. Pool was crowded and noisy on the weekend but settled down on Monday. Food was excellent, especially the snacks with drinks on the terrace overlooking Allen Street. Highly recommended if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Average and/or Poor in all regards”
Reviews.Author: amelialocks
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed at this hotel because its close to my husbands office. After this trip, we've sworn to never stay here again. For the price you are paying, the stay is incredibly AVERAGE in all regards, and has been frustrating more than a few times. The rooms are relatively clean (aside from the dingy rugs and the smell of mildew in the bathroom) and the door men are absolutely fantastic and helpful. The door men are actually the best thing about this place. It seems like everyone else is either absent minded or just not paying attention. Housekeeping has not cleaned the room once when we've requested service. The restaurant (and therefore room service) is only open for part of the day and closed two days of the week. There have been at least 4 occasions that I can easily recall when people come knocking at the door for turn-down service or some other unnecessary interruption when the DO NOT DISTURB sign is on the door. The concierge doesn't seem to really know the area and could not recommend any decent restaurants on the days when their restaurant was closed. Our stay has been over a week this trip and its been ample time to get a good idea about this hotel, and it has definitely gone down hill. The pool area is completely taken over by non-guests all weekend long so that there was never once an open seat available. It was more like a pool in Cabo during Spring Break with 2 to 3 people per lounge chair. Our room is over $500/night. For that price, there are FAR better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - super nice staff”
Reviews.Author: travelbabe1234
Reviews.Content: We go there once a year and we just love that place! It is a cool hotel with great spacious rooms. Big rooms compared to other hip hotels in NY! The bathrooms are huge with shower or/and bathtub! It is true that the diming system is a bit weird the first time but when you get it, its fine! The location of the hotel is great if you love the lower east side! Great restaurants around the corner! The staff is super nice and helpful! The pool is super nice during the week to chill in the sun! Drinks at Shang on the terrace is nice when they have this SAMBA band over! The Band is amazing! I recommand this hotel to my family and friends when they come to NY! Really a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Dark, but Cool Place”
Reviews.Author: mls7217
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, we had some reservations before staying at the Thompson given that some reviews led us to believe that we would need miners' hats to find our way around the dimly lit facilities. Well, if you are looking for bright lights in the big city, this is NOT the place for you, but for all others who don't mind a shadow or two, this is a great place to stay. First of all, the location was perfect as the subway station is right across the street and many areas of interest within walking distance. The staff could not have been more responsive and helpful. The room was spacious and the decor was modern with a black wood floor,a cement ceiling and a half wall of hanging metal beads. The shower was huge with a shower head the size of Staten Island. Now for the lighting situation. While the fixtures were somewhat on the dim side, there were two bright "spotlights" on each side of the bed which provided ample light for reading. We had no problems at all seeing what we needed to see. I have read complaints about the elevator lighting but why to you need bright lights there? The monitor in the elevator was showing a continuous loop of a Fellini movie, I think "8 1/2" which was pretty cool. There is a small outdoor pool on the third floor which was a nice place to hang out and enjoy a cocktail. On the 7th floor, there is a private bar/club with two outdoor patios which provide a great view of the city. The crowd was young, lively and fun and it was a nice place for a nightcap. Breakfast on the terrace was very pleasant but service was a tad slow one day. I know this place is pricey, but so is New York. We got a discount on a bigger room with a complimentary breakfast, so that helped. Regardless, the Thompson exuded a cool friendly vibe which made our stay very relaxing. Most assuredly, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Get New Management, Hire More Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ackhurst
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel unless they cut you a killer deal, and even then ask yourself how desperate you are! Fundamentally there's nothing wrong with the building, but the management suck, there are not enough staff, they are badly trained, they don't act upon complaints and do not deserve your custom. I can't be bothered to write an article length piece describing what went wrong, suffice to say everything that could, did. At your peril...

Reviews.Title: “Good Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seveonline
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of June x 3 nights. Loved the location, Soho walking distance, and some great restaurants all very close by. Hotel was great, nice spacious modern rooms, large walk-in showers and shared walk-out balcony. Service was efficient on front desk, and the doorstaff really freindly and very helpful. Would recommend and most probably would go back when next in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: vlbell01
Reviews.Content: We chose Thompson LES for its location. Easy to walk to interesting bars, restaurants and boutiques, and a short cab ride to Williamsburg. We arrived at 7pm and our room wasn't ready, which isn't really what you want to hear after a 7 hour flight. But, we were taken up to the bar and offered a cocktail on the house which actually did make things better, we only waited 10mins and we were in our room, all forgotten about. I was slightly concerned about out room (after reading a review about the 7th floor) which was opposite the club and right next to the lifts. But as we were out most nights, we never really had any problems with noise as there was a double door to our room, we could slightly hear music and people in and out of the club but never became an issue. We drank at Above Allen anyway one night (great views of the Empire State Building). But I possibly wouldn't have put bedrooms on the same floor as a club. However, we were extremely pleased with our room, it was huge! Gorgeous comfortable bed, amazing rainfall shower and great seating area, it was clean and modern. Maids came everyday to change towels etc and leave chocolates on the bed, we also requested an iron and they were straight up with one. Oh and Kiehl's products! If I could have changed anything I would have like to have seen a kettle and mugs in the room to make a cup of tea and free wifi (there was a laptop which you could check anything on for free at the front desk, but felt a little awkward with people around). And, not to have a room on the 7th floor. But I must say the staff were very welcoming and helpful all of the time and you were never once ignored, they are the best staff I have come across in a modern hotel, I wish they were like this in all hotels. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, for just a bed, but they need to get their act together.”
Reviews.Author: JRyles07
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with part of a bachelorette party. Overall the hotel has decent facilities, but the service leaves something to be desired. Check in was at 3pm, I arrived at 4:00, and was told my room was not yet ready. At 4:30, the room was finally ready. The elevators require the guest keys to go up and down, and everyone seems to have trouble with them including the staff. And the pool did not open on time either. The guest services book in my room said it opened at 8am, at 8:30am I called to ask why it was still locked. I was told that it didn't open till 9am. At 9:15, when the pool still wasn't open, I went down to the front desk, and was told the lifeguard had not yet arrived, and they couldn't open the pool till then. It's 9:30 and I'm still in my room waiting. I understand these things happen, but I feel like it's a bit of a pattern here. I will say the rooms are nice, albeit small (but it's a boutique hotel in NY, so that's to be expected). And the lobby, and pool look nice. My only other complaint is that the hallways are pretty dimly lit. I probably wouldn't stay here again, unless the service changes, but it's a nice hotel in a decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Love love love it”
Reviews.Author: Travelitupyo
Reviews.Content: Rooms are amazing, large and comfy! Bathroom I dream about. Service was insanely good. Will stay again! Skip the restaurant. Over priced and many better spots around!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dr_elliott_brender
Reviews.Content: A trendy hotel on the lower east side. We had 2 rooms, they adjoined with a common doorway whiich we rally liked. Very trendy neighborhood. Katz's delicatessen, Russ & Daughters lox, and Yonah Schimmel's knishes just down the block. Lots of great neighborhood eateries. Cabs easily available and the train is also down the block. Nice room. A bit spartan. My only grip - internet is $15 for 24 hours. Once activated its a use it or lose it. Not 24 hrs of internet time. Internet should be FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Great for certain travelers”
Reviews.Author: Denizen
Reviews.Content: Thompson LES would be a good choice for you if: --You'd rather stay downtown than midtown --You'd rather stay someplace a little more stylish than the norm --You're either out late partying on the weekends or can sleep through the sounds of other people out late partying on the weekends --You can figure out how to work the bath and lighting fixtures without having a snit This is one of my favorite places to stay in the city, but I can definitely see why it wouldn't be appropriate for some people. Basically, if you're a yuppie or hipster or young tourist, you're probably going to like it. If you're older or on a family trip or looking for a calm, well-lighted place to return to at the end of a long day of tourism, you're probably better off staying in one of the larger places in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, spacious but dark rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Fun2Travel13
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Thompson LES with my husband and young daughter in the Studio King Suite, a few days before Memorial Day (Wed night-Saturday morning). Here's a breakdown of our stay: Good: 1) The staff at the hotel were super friendly, quick and very helpful when asked for extra services (i.e. making up the sofa bed for my daughter, extra pillows, water service at the pool, giving directions to a good local bagel shop). I read previous reviews about arrogant staff but we very fortunate and never encountered a rude staff member. With a young child (our daughter is 4.5 years old), we were happy to work with many hotel staff members that were friendly and helpful. We were on the 8th floor away from the elevator and never heard the street sounds of NYC, loud guests or the nightclubs nearby. 2) Location was great for walking to Little Italy, Chinatown, East Village, NYU, etc. and tons of nightlife. Mixed (Good with Bad) 1) Outdoor pool was perfect for 80+ degree weather in NYC the week we were there. The pool staff members were great, the chaise lounges were comfortable for soaking up the sun but the size of the pool and surrounding area were small. Seats were limited and they filled up quickly with guests. During our stay, the pool was not available to use on Friday until 12:30 PM because there was no lifeguard on duty. The staff informed us that the guests were not allowed into the pool until a lifeguard was on duty. The news was very disappointing to my daughter who had to wait an hour until the pool was cleaned and the lifeguard was officially on duty. The pool staff did their best to accommodate my family and the other guests that were waiting to get into the pool (it was a challenge in 80+ degree weather). Thankfully, the pool was available early on Saturday when we returned to the pool the next morning. 2) Our room was huge (for NYC standards) and decor was modern but the room was extremely dark due to the black wood floors. The king sized bed was comfortable with soft bedding. The sofa bed was comfortable too. The A/C was working and effective cooling down the room for sleeping. The shower was stocked with Kiehl's toiletries and supplied good water pressure. With the black tiles, the bathroom was very dark. My parents are older and had trouble finding things when they came to visit the hotel room. Our room had a view of the pool which was nice for people-watching. Our daughter loved it. Bad: 1) The elevator situation was terrible. You had to use your key to get to any floor. Great for security but if you did not put the key in right or did not wait for the green light before pushing the appropriate button for your floor in time, you were taken to another floor. Very frustrating. I've stayed at many hotels with similar elevator systems and the Thompson's Hotel system needs some work or adjustments to make things easier for guests. 2) $15 for wireless internet service. We didn't try to use a cable to see if internet was complimentary in that format but it was confusing since our hotel reservations stated: complimentary internet access. Annoying. Overall, this is a very trendy hotel. According to my husband, lots of hipsters, Europeans and young people. Not exactly a family hotel but as a family staying there, we enjoyed the amenities and overall experience at the hotel. We've stayed at Le Parker Meridien (great burger joint in hotel and near central park), Millenium Hilton (great indoor pool and large rooms) and other hotels in NYC and the Thompson LES definitely had the trendiest vibe to it. P.S. Rocky's Pizzeria on 2nd Avenue, across the street from AMC Loews Theaters (movies) had great slices (if you like sweet pizza sauce). Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Super Chic Hotel but unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: outbackmatt
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Thompson LES a few times I have been continually surprised and disappointed by the pretentious and arrogant attitude of some (not all) of the staff. Mostly it's the reception staff that just have too much attitude which makes an unpleasant stay overall. Concierge have always been super nice. There are too many other great hotels nearby the want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but....”
Reviews.Author: frostbytez
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be way to noisy! We stayed from Fri-Mon and every night we were either interrupted by drunken people getting home at 3-4 in the morning or the fire alarm (which went off 2 of the 3 nights we were there!). Nobody bothered announcing it was a false alarm so everyone ended up evacuating the hotel in the middle of the night. The decor was nice. Very modern with a minimalistic decor but I think they need to take better care of this place. You can see the floors were starting to chip (as it was wooden)and the walls of the shower were getting moldy in the corners. I've stayed at 60 Thompson and I can say that one is much better!

Reviews.Title: “A very unfortunate check in experience.”
Reviews.Author: CorrinasTravels
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Thompson LES on April 21st. I was informed that my credit card would be charged in full at check in for the entire stay plus $150/night security deposit (I was staying 3 nights). This was unusual and my credit card was declined for the entire balance. I asked if I could put it on two cards and was told a very curt "No, we do not do that at the Thompson". I then asked if the gentleman checking me in had any other suggestions and he told me I could pay for the first night/deposit in cash. BUT that I would 'need to come down first thing tomorrow morning and make arrangements for the rest of my stay and that my access key would be shut off" At this point I was not feeling particularly welcome which seems odd as it's a hotel. A few minutes after entering my room a housekeeper was sent up to completely empty the minibar (despite my cash deposit). Not only feeling unwelcome, but insulted, I called my credit card company to see what the problem was and they informed me that there was already a $1500 hold on my credit card by the Thompson Hotel and an attempt for an additional $1500 charge which the credit card company denied (as it looked fradulent). Basically the gentleman checking me in had put the hold on, neglected to inform me and then had me go through the indignity of paying cash and emptying out the minibar. I then went back downstairs to explain this and the woman at the front desk was very helpful and apologized and offered to refund my cash. At this point I had spent close to 2 hours dealing with this check in issue. For the rates and reputation that this and the other Thompson hotels I've stayed at, I was not only unimpressed but incredibly insulted. I realize that human errors happen all the time, but this entire experience left a very bad impression on me. The Thompson Hotel LES should review their check in procedures and inform their staff that guests should still be made to feel like welcome guests even when there is a problem.....since sometimes it's not the guests problem, but the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hip place at a hip location”
Reviews.Author: Jspm
Reviews.Content: The place will get you in the real NYC mood in notime. Classy, but not over the top, modern but not inpractical, this place has it all. Go foe the LES, it is the place to be now!

Reviews.Title: “Very New York”
Reviews.Author: beautytravelerLondon
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night but liked it a lot. Very modern design, i guess you could call it industrial chic (bare concrete ceilings etc). Still very comfortable - especially the bed and the bathroom. My only gripe as with many modern design hotels is the lighting for wich you either need a manual or a PhD and which is always a bit too dark for anything other than sleeping. Would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Lofts Hotel Style”
Reviews.Author: scmcgloi
Reviews.Content: I reserved a one bedroom studio suite and lets say literally it felt as though I was back at home in my loft condo. If you're looking for the concrete meets wood with high end modern fixtures (think DWR) this is the place for you. My suite was spacious and the loft style bed was comfy. This place is all about the locals. The restaurant was excellent. I ate a lot of sushi which was very fresh. The bar/terrace/nightclub is beautiful but its definitely for the DJ spinning type. If your up for that than you'll have a blast. The 2nd floor lounge was nice a DJ spins late night on weekends and plays some very upbeat 70's tunes. Plus there's a terrace on the 2nd floor. The service was good. Not an overly super friendly place but then again I'm not there to be best friends with the staff. So if you want them to make you feel like family your bettter off just hanging with the locals. This place seems to attract a young at heart crowd. My favorite thing about this place is the location. Love the neighborhood. It was very lively. And for you die hard that love Whole foods there's one around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Thompson LES. Not the best they've done.”
Reviews.Author: spbyrne
Reviews.Content: Over the years I've stayed at many Thompson hotels on both coasts (Roosevelt, GuildHall, Thompson St, 6 Columbus) but this was by far the most disappointing experience. While the rooms are large and well designed, I was staying in a corner room #1000 with balcony (great views of LES) and found the noise (til around 2am) from the bar/restaurant and from the hallways more disturbing than that from Allen Street and nearby Houston. Admittedly I had jetlag from a 22 hour flight from Australia but hotel-sponsored noise is the last thing you want anywhere when you have to front up for a two way conference. While the staff are pleasant, the hotel simply lacks ambience of any kind, whether it's in the lobby or the bar/restaurant. Not to the usual Thompson standard. And when are they going to implement a loyalty scheme as they continue to expand? I won't be staying here next time I'm in NY.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to New York - can't wait to stay at Thompson LES again!”
Reviews.Author: Marshallb60
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit more minimal than we would usually go for but fitted New York to a T. The room was on the 15th floor and had the most amazing which started at the Brooklyn Bridge and finished past the Empire State building. The floor to ceiling glass and wrapp around balcony ensured that the view could be enjoyed to the maximum. The shower was amazing and the Kiehls products were also very nice. The bed was huge and made it hard to get up was very welcome after a hard day sight seeing and evenings out. The hotel has a gym area and spa which were able to use before going to the airport as our flight back was at night. Finally the staff were brilliant. Very friendly and helpful. Would like to stay at Thmpson LES again in the summer to use the roof top pool and to see that view again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...AFTER we switched rooms”
Reviews.Author: zzzraymond
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just completed a weekend stay at the Thompson LES. Let me start with the positives: --We really liked the industrial-chic decor and the arty accents in the different rooms (more on this below in the negatives). It's not everyone's cup of tea, but hey, you (should) know what you're getting into when booking this hotel. --The entire staff -- from check-in and bell hop to the cleaning crew -- was warm and very helpful. --The location is the perfect base for exploring the wonderful restaurants and the lively bars nearby. Btw, if you want to go to the Clinton St. Bakery on a weekend, wake up early and put your name down when it opens, come back to the hotel and sleep for another 2 hours, then go back and your table will be ready. --The bed and couch are very comfy, and the bathroom is quite nice if a bit claustrophobic. Now the negatives. We arrived on Friday evening and were given a room on the 7th floor, right next to the elevators and across from the exit of the bar/club on the floor. As many other reviewers have noted, if you're staying on floors 6-8 on a weekend, you WILL hear everything. You will hear the ding when elevators arrive, the thumping music when people open the doors to the club, the drunken chatter of those who linger in the hallway. I went down to the lobby at around 1:30am and requested a room change. The front desk guy was very apologetic and very quickly switched me to a larger room, a queen suite. Still, he commented how they've had a lot of noise issues with the 7th floor rooms. To which I wanted to say, "Then why did you put me there in the first place, especially on a weekend?" So, all in all a very good experience despite the short drama. But make sure you avoid the 7th floor!!

Reviews.Title: “Could use an instruction book or manual for the room otherwise a very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SeaviewKing15
Reviews.Content: Positives: Amazing location, where Lower East Side meets East Village and SOHO. Great restaurants, entertainment, culture and shopping nearby. Room 1403. King Jr. Suite (I think). was spacious with sitting area, large flat screen TV, and great view (southeast) from the 14th floor. I was told this was an upgrade from a Deluxe King. Bed was comfortable. Trendy appearance to room. Modern design. The bed had an attractive lit landscape. The slate or marble bathroom was attractive and functional. We had a large shower with a rain-type spout. Service Front desk was excellent. We needed an ironing board and iron in a hurry and they sent one right up. There is a concierge service and we received an excellent restaurant recommendation. The daily NY Times was appreciated Public Areas We did not eat in the restaurant, but the cocktail lounge looked attractive. Second floor lobby was confortable. There is a trendy rooftop lounge that had a DJ. The lounge is for members only and hotel guests. I thought that was a nice gesture because I remember another trendy hotel in the meatpacking district that cleared the guests out of their top floor lounge at 9 PM so that others could be rejected at the velvet rope. The treatment here is a bit more standard among good hotels. The crowd was mostly in their 20s. It was not for us, but looked like fun. Negatives The tower looks like an eyesore to me. It stands out in stark concrete. A north-south view would have been more interesting so that one could view the skyscrapers in midtown and the harbor below, but the orientation of the building is a minor criticism and the view was interesting to explore. The room also looked a bit stark and industrial with the unfinished concrete ceiling. I guess that is a matter of taste. I couldn't for the life of me figure out how to use the hotel phone and the complicated shower. The bed had a lit landscape above it. I had to fumble around with every light switch Some instruction would have helped. Free internet would be nice. The hotel is pricey but not out of character for the area. I would call it an average value. All-in-all, we would like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks Warmth, Better Options for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Annagins
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my one night stay at Thompson LES, though I wouldn't stay there again due to the fact there are better options out there for the money. While it definitely strives to be hip and cool, it lacks the warmth of other hip and trendy hotels such as W Union Square and Morganâ€™s. First off, check-in. As far as service goes, the people at the check-in desk were the friendliest and most efficient. No problems there. The concierge desk was another story. I think Thompson was trying to hire smart, good looking student types, but they seemed like they didnâ€™t really want to be at work and lacked some social and service skills that more experience concierges have mastered. In every encounter I had with them be it asking the best way to get to the airport or needing help printing a boarding pass, I felt they were anxious to get rid of me. Maybe they were, but a good concierge doesnâ€™t let the customer know it. Iâ€™ve stayed at a enough hotels and in most cases, the concierges have exuded friendliness along with their professionalism. The room itself was very comfortable. The lack of carpet, again, took away some warmth, but it also seemed cleaner without it. The views were outstanding, the bed was comfortable (very) and the flat screen TV was great with easy access to lots of good channels. The bathroom was another story. It was small, very dark, didnâ€™t have a lot of room to set things, and lacked a tub. The shower, once I figured out the settings, was pretty nice. However, unless you are okay with the water raining straight down on your head, it seems you have to hold the sprayer. But the biggest pet peeve â€“ No shower cap! Luckily, Iâ€™d brought the one I asked for at the other hotel. Iâ€™ve mentioned the shower cap in reviews and am probably being nit-picky at this point, but still. It was an issue. Okay, as youâ€™ve probably guessed, no in-room coffee. A small pot brought to your room was $10.00. Not a bad deal, but not great. I guess itâ€™s a lot cheaper and easier for a hotel to just leave coffee pots out of rooms, but it makes the ones who keep them in seem more luxurious. The room service menu was great, but only if you like Asian food. It would have been nice to see a few more diverse items included in the menu. Something simple and healthy like a turkey sandwich would have been nice, but there was lots of sushi, noodle dishes and satay. Also, I didnâ€™t see any wine by the glass. I understand a lot of hotels donâ€™t have this, but why not? Iâ€™d rather pay $10 for one glass of wine than buy a $40 half bottle Iâ€™m not going to drink. The location was pretty good if your plans include lots of bar hopping and clubbing, but if you love shopping and browsing around stores, itâ€™s only good if the weather is good. The closest shopping area was half mile away, which doesnâ€™t sound too far, but if itâ€™s snowy and icy itâ€™s far. If I were going to stay in that area again, Iâ€™d probably pick a hotel a little closer to the shops. I really was excited about staying here and was hoping to give a 5 star review, but compared to the competition, this just wasn't 5 stars. I think they could easily fix the problems and make this hotel worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Dilbee_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night when in NYC for a wedding. It is absolutely gorgeous. We got a spacious suite with a living area, bedroom, showers with rain shower heads, and a seperate bath which was HUGE! The hotel was spotless and the amenities were higher-end products (I believe they were C.O Bigelow). The service was quick and the staff friendly. The decor was minimalist but very cool at the same time. The guest mini-bar had EVERYTHING you could possibly need! The location is on the lower East Side which was very convenient and near a lot of great spots, both within walking distance or a short cab ride. We went to Little Italy for dinner the night before the wedding and it was about a 5 minute cab ride. I hope to go back to the Thompson soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great views and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jansson-Olsson
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location! Especially for all the bars and restaurants in Lower East Side and Nolita and the shopping in Soho. We had a double on the 15th floor and had views over southern Manhattan, from Downtown to Empire State. The room has a window from floor to ceiling, a modern bathroom and a nice bed. The interior of the hotel is however not as hip or modern as they would like it to be, slightly impersonal. The pool is probably great in the summer though! We thought that the hotel was great value in a trendy location but would have wished for a slightly more personal style and free WiFi!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: megsey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Thompson LES six or so times since it opened and have always been very pleased. Having lived in NYC for many years, we now call LA home but are back frequently for business and to visit friends. Here are the great things about the hotel: location (wonderful restaurants, shops and bars on literally every block), rooms (always clean, well-styled, comfortable beds and great toiletries) and the staff is wonderful. Here are the cons: it can be a noisy hotel depending on your floor, proximity to the elevator and night of the week. If you end up in a smaller room it can seem pricey for what you're getting. The surrounding neighborhood can turn into a hotbed of partying twenty-somethings on weekends. Great hotel for people who are more urban or artistically minded, but I wouldn't recommend it to my grandmother.

Reviews.Title: “Once again great stay”
Reviews.Author: beatricepugzilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed once again due to to the great location, large hotel rooms for the price and the wonderful front desk and other staff folks - was not disappointed. This time found what they call the spa - what I found was an awesome fitness center - last time around the weather was fine so the run was outside - this time there was a blizzard and the staff let me know they had a few treadmills on the lower level - it was more than a few treadmills! Cannot wait to go back in a few months. This place is great

Reviews.Title: “One of the best stays in NYC”
Reviews.Author: pch80
Reviews.Content: Thompson Les is just awesome. We arrived the day after the blizzard with our young son and they were so friendly and attentive! We had the King studio suite and it was AWESOME! Great size, amazing shower, out of this world view of the LES. I did not think it was too dark at all but very soothing however I can some people thinking that.. it's just a matter of preference. For me, it was perfect. Everything I asked for was delivered with perfection. The concierge service was also exemplary, They got us everything we wanted including a great sitter for our child through the best service in NYC for them. I felt very much at home there. It was super chic, stylish and cool but NEVER snooty that is of course aside from the manager from Above Allen. We had a few complaints about our New Years Eve experience with the bar and although neither the bar or the hotel was responsible for throwing the party.. the name of the bar and hotel is used to sell the tickets so it would have been nice for this person to at least feign a degree of interest in our complaints and maybe some empathy we had to have such an unpleasant experience. Mr. or Ms. Chien showed neither. I take away one star for having such a rude person be the manager at a bar at your hotel. This ridiculous trend of hotels claiming to be different businesses than the lounges on their premises and therefore not accepting any responsibility for any bad experiences you have there or don't have there because sometimes you can't even get in (i.e. standard) is offensive to it's patrons. Those bars pay them money to have their bar there and they benefit from any allure the bar brings. But aside from that.. Thompson LES Rocked. I would recommend it to everyone I know. But I would never recommend it for New Years Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Chic”
Reviews.Author: sselhorst
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very helpful in directing me to some amazing places (for late night food, music etc.). The room was cushy, unique and beautiful, with a great view, and the bar was fantastic. The shower was heavenly!

Reviews.Title: “The Thompson is a nice hotel but bring a flashlight.”
Reviews.Author: Ellsw0rth
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a three day stay at the Thompson LES. This was my first stay at the Thompson, we usually stay at the Giraffe when visiting Manhattan, but for a variety of reasons decided to try the Thompson for this visit. We stayed in a King Suite. First the positives: The room (by Manhattan standards) was quite large, it was clean and well designed with adequate storage, our room was very quiet, the fixtures and furnishings are well designed and very contemporary. The staff was very efficient and responded quickly to all inquiries. There are many restaurants, shops and a great little movie theater within easy walking distance. In explaining my negatives, I should point out I am a senior citizen and my negatives may not be important to other people. First, the lobby has all the warmth and ambiance of a cement factory (concrete floors, ceilings and tile walls). Black and dark gray are the predominant colors throughout the hotel and the low level lighting made it feel as if I was constantly in the twilight zone. The room is constructed primarily of concrete and tile in black or dark gray. Even the wood floors are black. If Johnny Cash walked in the room you probably wouldn't be able to find him. I felt like I should be carrying a flashlight to find the correct button in the elevator; however, the Fellini black and white movies constantly showing in the elevator were interesting. With the lights set at the brightest, I could not comfortably read in the room, except in bed - and that light was difficult to direct. All the lighting was either recessed ceiling, bare bulb or spotlight type with the exception of one small low wattage lamp. There is a small lobby seating area on the second floor which we were told we could use but it has more the feel of a cocktail lounge than an area you would relax and read the paper or enjoy a cup of coffee. The only food service is an Asian restaurant located on the second floor which we tried the first evening. The chef had received very good reviews but we found the food unremarkable. And speaking of coffee, you could get breakfast at the bar area on the second floor but since it wasn't very inviting, I went to one of the nearby delis for morning coffee (no problem unless it's freezing or snowing out). Complimentary coffee to go with the complimentary newspaper would be a nice addition. While the hotel is not my favorite - other people may find it to their taste.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel on the LES”
Reviews.Author: hollyverona
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at this hotel and am OVERLY pleased with the service, cleanliness, location and everything.. Really truly wonderful. I'm not sure what happened with the folks on here who said they got horrible service because everyone was so pleasant, nice, and helpful to us. The room was upgraded for free since they had extra space available and I got a discounted rate for staying a second night. While it's still an expensive hotel, I think it was well worth it to be at this amazing location, in such a stylish and fun atmosphere. I will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Hope you don't need a towel while you're here!”
Reviews.Author: LYSF3450
Reviews.Content: We travel frequently - this is the 3rd trip to NYC in 3 weeks. We were just in Rome and London. We've been to this hotel 3 times. Each time we have terrible service, but we love the location so we keep giving them another chance. During this current stay it's clear we should only ever expect the poor service we've grown accustomed to here. There are two of us in a room. Today, we realized they removed the one robe we had been sharing and only left us with one medium-sized towel. We called three times to get a second towel that never came. This was after we left housekeeping a large tip yesterday. Apparently if you leave a tip, they don't want you to shower again. We tried renting a movie, there was something wrong with our TV, we called the front desk, they asked to send someone up to the room - who never came.
