So, we asked them to remove the movie we couldn't watch from our bill. They couldn't do it. We had a friend come stay with us at the last minute. We asked housekeeping if they would make up the extra bed. And of course, we left a tip for this. They never made up the bed. We called that night to ask for bedding to make the bed ourselves, they brought up one sheet, no blanket, no pillow. Don't stay here - there are plenty of options nearby with better value that will make you feel much more welcome than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Hipster Clothes & Hipster Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Eugie1981
Reviews.Content: Normally, my husband and I stay in Midtown Manhattan - East, but on the advice of friends that live in NYC we stayed at the Thompson LES. First impressions of the hotel is that it is extremely modern and extremely "hip." The front desk staff was not overly friendly or attentive. The room we received was small, but it's the city and that's to be expected. We were on the 18th floor and had a gorgeous view of the lower east side. My favorite part of the room was the shower in the bathroom - it happened to be very spa-like and we both appreciated that. Housekeeping staff was virtually non-existent. We left the room at 9am and returned at 4pm and the room was still not made up - until we called the front desk and requested it be cleaned. No apologies were made for housekeeping "overlooking" our room. The best feature of the hotel is their outside bar area - it's a very cool crowd, but it's a fun place to have drinks with friends. I would not rush to stay there again, but it was an okay experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “To experience what its like to live and play the hip Lower East Side, Thompson LES cant be beat.”
Reviews.Author: hfjamma3
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience what its like to live and play in one of NY city's hippest downtown areas, the Thompson LES is the ticket. There is the vibe and the feel , the luxurious bedding, the amazing showers, the cozy/chic 2nd floor lobby lounge, and the views out the glass fronted rooms. Then there is the amazing freshness and cutting edge feel of the food, drink, music,boutique etc., offerings right outside the front door . The Fellini scenes playing in the elevators, the exclusive 7th floor bar hot spot , and an adorable concierge duo are the perfect finishing touches. When i stayed over Halloween weekend , I couldn't get enough of my fantasy life as a downtown New Yorker. BRAVO Thompson Group. You have the perfect convergence of all the right elements in your yummy LES hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, but trying too hard to be cool and coming up short.”
Reviews.Author: dbalko
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were staying in NYC for my best friends wedding. First the good stuff. The hotel is in a good location if you are looking for a weekend in the Lower East Side. Loads of great bars (try the Double Crown) and great restaurants (Eight Mile Creek) Now for the not so great stuff. We checked in at 6.30pm after flying in from London only to be told the room wasn't ready despite calling a week before and asking that everything was okay. We were offered a free drink at the bar, but really all I wanted was a shower before we went out! We were then shown our room and whilst it was clean and tidy, it stank of cigarette smoke. After more complaining the hotel eventually agreed to move us to another room. Now for the critical stuff. We've stayed in NYC at loads of hotels previously and whilst this one was in a great place, it lacked any sense of charm. It's very cool, but very cold. The rooms were very small even by NYC standards and more could be had for the same money, (try Soho House or The Crosby) with exceptional service in comparison. At Thompson LES we called for room service on the Sunday only to be told that the menu was very limited as it was a Sunday. This would be fine in a rural hotel in Spain, but not in NYC! To end on a good note the bar on the 12th floor was good fun - loads of very cool people and the views uptown were great. Beyond that, not much to say really...there are of course loads of good bars in NY so don't let this tempt you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vincexchase
Reviews.Content: I just stayed @ the thompson les this week for my girlfriends birthday. I booked a one room queen suite. When i was checking in the lady told me i had been upgraded to a corner king room w a balcony! The rooms was AMAZING. The design and ambience was perfect. The view outside of the balcony was beautiful. I actually had 16 people over (not to sleep over) for my girlfriends birthday and everyone enjoyed. The service was wonderful too. The employees were so respectful and helpfull. I thought they would be suspect when i was bringing cake and a party of people upstairs but they were totally okay with it. The price of the room was expensive but it was totally worth it. Esp w my upgrade. I would highly recommend this hotel and stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch stay at Thompson LES”
Reviews.Author: adgnyc
Reviews.Content: I was just looking for a nice weekend getaway with some friends and someone recommended the Thompson LES hotel. From the moment I arrived the service was amazing! I was greeted at the curb by the bellman and was surprised that once I had arrived at the front desk, they already knew my name! Not only was the staff helpful in many ways but they were also pretty good looking. What made things even better was, they upgraded me to a king suite on the 15th floor with an amazing view and a massive terrace! I was also able to check out the bars in the hotel on the 2nd and 7th floor. We enjoyed them so much there was no need to leave the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and I will most certainly return for another weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The pinnacle of a New York visit; great service, great view!”
Reviews.Author: Spearshaker
Reviews.Content: The Thompson LES is a great hotel, we were greeted on the street by the bellhop, and the service was excellent from the minute we got there, to the minute we left! The room was perfectly clean, and the view from the 17th floor was stunning. The bathroom was great, and the shower to die for. We wish we could stay for more than 2 nights! Everything you need is close by, great food around Allen St and especially Katz's Deli. It's close to subway stations and cabs are just right outside. This is a hotel we would return to if we could!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: f64_10
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem in one of the best neighborhoods in NYC. My wife and I needed a hotel last minute and we called directly to them and got a great price. Our room was big and had a large balcony overlooking the lower east side. It was amazing!!. We had lunch and drinks at the pool, watched the sunset from our balcony and had probably the best hotel experience we've ever had in NYC. The Staff was friendly and helpful and overall the experience was a real positive. This is coming from people who travel all over the world. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel perfectly situated on the Lower East Side”
Reviews.Author: Scottsdale1
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very modern and comfortable. We like the trendy area, terrific restaurants, and easy access to this part of town. The 7th floor bar gives great views and vibrant atmosphere. Staff is generally friendly. The King studio suite was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel in chic part of town...”
Reviews.Author: Sasman23
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel in chic part of town lots of great restaurants close by & in hotel the sushi is great. Hotel staff were very helpful and the views from the bar on the 7 th floor is one of the best

Reviews.Title: “Good...but...”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Caridi
Reviews.Content: Great location and a very cool hotel... but as mentioned by a previous review we also booked a room with two double beds and on arrival were told that they didn't have any of those rooms left (even though we booked a month in advance). They tried to sell us the room with the double bed and a fold out on the floor right above the pool but we said that this was unacceptable and on night 2-5 we were up on level 12 with a great view and the two double beds. Lastly, took the authorization for the full amount off my card on arrival and on departure! $5,000 USD I talked to the girl at reception but she told me that was impossible and i should speak to my bank, even though i showed her on the iphone i had in my hand. Overall, nice place, great area... but would probably try another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonThelma
Reviews.Content: We had a great few days staying at this hotel. We booked a deluxe double but decided to upgrade to a one bedroom suite as there were four of us - a good idea, although the sofabed was not that comfortable for our teenagers. The staff were superb, the location is great - lower east village is very trendy with lots of stylish bars and restaurants nearby. The only criticism was the charge for wifi - free at the little cafe two doors along, and the fact the bar on the 7th floor is closed two nights a week - with amazing views of the Empire State Building we wanted to have drinks there, but it was closed for two nights of our stay and the one night it was open it was full of 'members' - really hotel residents should be able to use it. But we would definitely recommend it and will return.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous rooms... unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jbeanlovesveggies
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, last minute. They quoted us one price on the phone and something different once inside. Gorgeous property & gorgeous rooms but staff was unwilling to give us a late check out, or accommodate our needs. Disappointing considering the price of a room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service, Unfriendly Staff, Incompetent Managers”
Reviews.Author: Atifeh
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of girls. To begin, they cancelled the wrong type of room (2 double beds) so we had a bed and a pullout sofa. However, that room wasn't available until after 6 p.m. (check in is at 3 p.m.) ... and we had 6:15 dinner reservations. The front desk told us it was because a cleaning person didn't show. But then a manager told us that wasn't correct and said she'd call us back. She never did. They did NOTHING to compensate for this despite multiple calls. When we got in that night, there were no sheets for the pullout. We called THREE times for sheets and still didn't have any. During one of those calls, the male manager asked if I was from South Carolina (I'm not) ... as if customer service only exists in the south! Then two of us went downstairs to the lobby (to yell at the manager) to get sheets. We still had to call a FOURTH time about 20 minutes later to get sheets! We finally got sheets at 2 a.m. Of course, that didn't make much difference because they put us in the worst rooms in the hotel: right across from the club (bar) ... like 6 feet away with no barrier door. The music and yelling in the hallway finally stopped at 3 a.m. The next day, my friend called to speak to a manager (again) about the previous day. There was no manager on site on a Saturday! However, whoever she talked to said that I had been "physically threatening" and for this reason they wouldn't accommodate us. Granted, I may have been verbally abusive after receiving zero customer service by almost 2 in the morning, but I'm 5'3" and weigh 110 pounds. If that manager--who I didn't touch--felt threatened by my physical presence, they need new staff! Additionally, the bathroom is tiny with only glass separating it from the room, the outlet that I searched high and low to find didn't charge my cell phone, something looked like it had been ripped off the wall, there's only one small mirror in the bathroom, the shower was difficult to turn on and once it was turned on didn't get very hot. STAY ELSEWHERE AND TAKE THE SUBWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here. Worst service ever!!”
Reviews.Author: JasperW1
Reviews.Content: At our day of our arrival, the hotel turned out to be overbooked. We had a reservation, but we had to move an other Thompson hotel. At first the girl told us that it was our mistake, later they assured us that it was the mistake of the booking company, but in the end, after a lot of calls and arguments, it turned out that it was just the mistake of the hotel. That room was more expensive and we had to take a taxi to the wallstreet area. Besides that i don't like that part of New York, this hotel didn't have a swimming pool. We choose the LES Thompson hotel because it had a swimming pool. My father doesn't walk that well, so if we went shopping, he could spend some time at the pool. After the first night at the other Thompson hotel, we could check in after 3/4 AM. Happy about finally be at the hotel we would spend 4 nights, we were looking forward to take a referessing jump in the pool. Only this wasnt possible because there was a private party at the pool. 2 days later the pool was again not available of another private party!!! And the internet was down too! By checking in I had to pay a average roomprice of about $260. For 3 nights they charged my credit card for $1340. They assured us that the deposit of $150 a night ($450) would be payed back to me after checking out. After checking out they told us the samen and i would have the money back on my credit card back right away. A month and several expensive phonecalls, a lot of promisses to fix it and call me back, I still didn't get the money back. They even didn't call me back a single time or replied to my emails. Oh and don't order drinks at the pool. We ordered a cup of coffee, a mineral water and a orange juice and had to pay 45$. We had to pay 2 times the service tax and the gratuity, because brought it two time (first the juice and the water, and later the coffee). The most funny part was that the waiter asked for an extra tip!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: mwellsVenice_CA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 60 Thompson before and was curious to try the new Thompson LES. We booked a room with two double beds and when we got to the room we were stationed on the 7th floor across from the bar. Our room was huge by NYC standards with really nice modern decor. I especially liked the light installations over the bed which doubled as artwork. We also had a view to the pool downstairs. Overall I really liked the hotel. Pluses: 1. Location - the LES is fully gentrified now so it was nice to be in the middle of this vibrant, transformed neighborhood. 2. Lots of amazing restaurants around and I loved that they had a wash a fold every other block 3. Pool - enough said. Not easy to come by in NY and being that we were there in the summer, our kids were so happy 4. Service - I love that the staff was almost too friendly. I prefer overly attentive service to little or none 5. Surprisingly, I would recommend this hotel for families. It served our needs well. Minuses: 1. On our third day there there was a pool party. Every hipster in Manhattan was there and wanted to get in to the pool area. We had invited friends to join us to swim but because of the party, there was no way we could congregate by the pool. Fortunately we went up to the rooftop lounge and hung out there instead. 2. On weekends, you can hear noise from the club across the way from our room in the hallway. This happened on Sat night where one person was talking on his cel right in front of our door, likely to get away from the music in the club. 3. No wi-fi - I think any hotel that still charges a daily rate in this day and age is BEHIND with the times. This should be worked into the room rate and provided universally. The good thing was, they had a laptop for use in the lobby that had free wi-fi but it would have been nice to have it in the room.

Reviews.Title: “noisy, only good if you like music at night”
Reviews.Author: dikmus
Reviews.Content: Many rooms are next to bars, impossible to sleep when they are open, if you want to party till early hours, this might be a good choice. otherwise stay away !!!!

Reviews.Title: “don't stay there on Saturday night if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: inSF
Reviews.Content: This is a very hip hotel, if you'll be out and about on Saturday until 2am this will be fine. The thumping kept us up all night after a flight in from SF. I paid $180 + taxes on Priceline and had this feeling I was going to end up here:( I did get a mini bar charge that I found later, but it's being cancelled now. Oops? The building is new, the rooms very modern, the bathroom spacious, the neighborhood OK. A wonderful bell hop. I can't believe that families stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - meeting room tech....?”
Reviews.Author: beatricepugzilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip to NYC office. Picked hotel due to location and to get NYC staff out of midtown office for two days of meetings. Check in was a breeze and the staff could not have been nicer. The room was awesome with great amenities. It was a corner on a high floor - great balcony. Room was large and not just in NYC terms. Each AM early went for a run and left my key at the front desk - not sure of the name of the gentleman that works the front desk early (like 5:45 to 6:45AM) but he gladly took my key and had it waiting for me as soon as I ran back in - Very nice. The meeting room - media room 3rd floor - great lay out. but upon inspection lighting chords were frayed and not working - outlets were coming out of walls. Trash is bathroom trash can upon arrival. Was suprised to see and be told that if we wanted to use the flat screen TV for projecting from the computer that we should have brought our own connections??? The hotel did not provide??? For a meeting room??? After about an hour a service tech came and hooked up the AV after one of my coworkers explained how to hook up the cables - strange. maybe they went out and bought them since we were told they did not have them in the first place? Good thing we are in the event business and can make anything work. Would I stay here again? ABSOLUTELY and cannot wait to get back. Would I have a meeting here again? NO WAY

Reviews.Title: “Not for Children & Families”
Reviews.Author: SummerTravelers04
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with your significant other as a "couples getaway" by all means, this hotel is beautiful. It is off the "beaten path" and is in a trendy and "unique?" neighborhood. We did hear that the neighborhood was safe, but it appeared otherwise. We were not comfortable there with our children. It is located right across the street from a subway station, so that was a plus and very convienent. Again, the hotel itself is very aesthetically pleasing, the room design is beautiful, but without a doubt more for adults only. The staff was wonderful and very accomodating, everyone was very friendly overall. I would recommend this hotel to young trendy couples wanting to stay away from the touristy areas, but I could not recommend for a family with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place - hip and trendy and good location”
Reviews.Author: bearadvisor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 10 nights for business with a very decent rate for the period (~250$/night). My room was on the 8th floor just on top of the lounge of the 7th floor. Gets noisy certain nights but I was so tired I didn't care much about the music, but some light sleepers might. Room was very nice, very comfy bed, large nice shower, large LCD screen, not so comfortable desk chair though, more hip and fancy than practical. Not a big fan of the fancy stylish light switches too which are terribly annoying (at least for me) to manipulate. Internet is 10$ per 24h period, which is a bit annoying, it should really be free especially as the 24h period is not quite reliable... Room is missing ironing board which is something that tend to be useful when staying a long time. Gym is a bit small and layout is not extremely convenient. Access is slightly annoying as it can be done 'only' through the middle elevator which you can call specifically only from the lobby or 2nd floor. Small annoyance but nothing serious. Lounge is a bit disappointing to have drinks on the evening, you will get better one at the bar on the 2nd floor. Cocktails are around 15$. Location is great as there are plenty of restaurants to go to around Orchard st. otherwise Soho is a couple of blocks away. Easy access to subways too. Overall a pretty good place and stands out from the rest of the NYC hotels. Pretty hip and trendy place.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again...definitely”
Reviews.Author: geauxtigers318
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I recently stayed in a king suite at the Thompson LES. We loved it. The location is unbeatable...in the LES, near SoHo, a subway stop right across the street. It makes walking to a variety of restaurants and shops quick and easy. This is a great neighborhood away from the lights and noise of Times Square. The room was nice and our room was quiet as well. We had a view of the pool and a side street. At night there was no noise despite being one floor below the bar. The bed was comfortable, and we used the pull out bed as well. The hotel staff even came up at 1:30am to make the sofa bed for us and were nice and cheerful on top of that! Plus, and this is important given the heat-wave in NYC that weekend, the shower was fantastic! The room price was much better than other hotels we researched and we all felt like we got a good value. The service was good. From making up the bed late to daily cleaning, it was perfect. Specifically, on our last day there was a problem getting a taxi due to a subway problem. Within 20 minutes the hotel had a car service arranged to bring us to the airport. I would most certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly happy with the LES”
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Brown.95
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Thompson LES a few times in the past three months. My colleague and I get a double deluxe room which is not that large or deluxe, but for NYC, it is fine. The rooms are very spartan, but comfortable. The last time we were there, a few items in our room didn't work great- the faucets and shower were quirky (Like having a really hard time getting full water flow in the shower, only hot water coming out of the bathroom faucet) and some signs of wear were evident in the bathroom/grout and ceiling. I always choke when paying over $300 a night for a hotel with rooms this small and spare, but comparatively to other hotels in Manhattan, this is a good value. I love the location, right across from the LES subway stop and in the heart of a great neighborhood. The staff is generally helpful and friendly. The restaurants are definitely overpriced but the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - great location”
Reviews.Author: dvtravelling
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend to New York. The place is very good located in New York. Most things (SoHo etc) in walking distantance. Very good Restaurants around the corner (WD 50). The view out of the hotel room on lower Manhattan is AMAZING. The rooms have a nice design. Clean and cool. They are a bit tiny. No real closet. So if you stop during a longer travel in New York with 3-4 bags the room will be almost occupied by your bags. Price seems very good for the location and the gorgeous view. Would definetively go there again.

Reviews.Title: “My son's 21st Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: anne677
Reviews.Content: My son and his friend and his cousin and I stayed in this Hotel for my sons 21st Bday! It was so awsome we had a ball, they were the nicest people, very good service and we got a great deal on this venue. I was going to book the Waldorf Astoria but , they suggested this Hotel because my son was young, they felt the Waldorf was to old for his age group> It was very different but we loved this Hotel. They have a built in pool on the third flood with a painting by Andy Warhol on the bottom. Such a trendy hotel as well as the area. This Hotel truly made my sons bday so great!! THANK YOU HOTEL THONPSON LES!! I cannot say enough about this hotel had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaloneV
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place below 14th Street, this is it. The location couldn't be more perfect for those that want to shop, eat, drink and just soak in daily life in NY. Yes, Brooklyn is where everyone cool has gone, but I still love the LES! The hotel is a great deal if you find a good price online (we found a king suite with sitting area for $300 per night). Are you kidding me? The Holiday Inn on Lafayette costs that much! This hotel is chic and has plenty of common areas, including a small pool. The subway station is across the street!! Staff is attentive and great (other than the wait person in the bar on the 2nd floor, holy moly she was pretty and her talents really ended there) and the cleaning staff deserve a special shout-out! They were fantastic. The downfall here is the gym. It's a sad, tiny room, even lacking yoga mats.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and sleepless”
Reviews.Author: migamiga
Reviews.Content: Writing this at around midnight, as I thought I might make use of my time seeing as I can't sleep. I can sleep through a lot of things - but as I type the floor of our room on the 8th floor is shaking with the bass from the nightclub directly below us. There is no indication that there is a nightclub in this hotel, and the front desk staff were pointing out that it's a bar. In my understanding a place that plays loud disco music untile 230AM qualifies as a nightclub. I am an unfussy traveller; but I think it's pretty basic for a hotel, especially one that charges $350 for a night's stay, to provide its customers a night's rest (not just coochy lighting and velvet ropes for the nightclub's patrons). Another interesting point is that I'm typing this using a $10 a day wi fi service (compared to complimentary wi fi at most hotel chains including budget ones like Holiday Inn). If you like Eurythmics at ear splitting volume past midnight this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: paloma1000
Reviews.Content: Check in was great, stay was great, room was very comfortable. A little smal but worth the view. Lots of windows and the shower was amazing. Room service prices were reasonable (All Sushi...Susur Lee runs SHang downstairs) We ran out of towels one day. They don't give you many. But, we called and they brought some up immediately. When checking out, the rate was wrong. I couldn't finf my booking email and the reservation site was 'down' mysteriously' I paid the full rate and they said to call when found. i did and was told the manager was in a meeting but would call me back. No call back. I call the next day and explain again. Said i'll get a call back. no call back. Just as i was going to call for a third time, I received a call and said they'll credit me the diff. It just ha penned so I'll have to see if it actually gets credited back. The club was loud. It was hot outside and we wanted windows open but the noise was bad.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: cri1970
Reviews.Content: This is the letter I wrote to them after my horrible experience: "I booked a king room on April 9th, one month ago, and organized my 2 days in NY around the Thompson LES. Instead I ended up in a horrible hotel on Wall Street and was told by your assistant to "not take it personally". Please explain to me how I should not take it personally when both my vacation and dinner party were ruined. I was told the guest who was supposed to check out "refused to leave the room". In all the years I have been traveling I have never heard of anything more ridiculous. Furthermore, this same guest was permitted to stay in the room knowing that another guest, who had a confirmed reservation for over a month, would be refused her hotel accommodations. The credit card number I gave to guarantee my reservation served what purpose? Not only was I turned away but I was sent to another hotel that was a nightmare. This alternative hotel should have been offered to the guest who did not have a reservation and refused to leave instead of me. Does this mean that rooms in the Thompson hotels are available only if the previous guests decide to leave? I'm sure you will agree how absurd this is." Just DO NOT GO Cristiana

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here on my next visit too”
Reviews.Author: totocas
Reviews.Content: A colleague recommended this place to me and I was skeptical initially- I actually stayed twice here on the same business trip (about 7 nights in total) and it was excellent both times. It is a designer/boutique hotel, or however you want to call it - very dark decor, classic furnishings, all dark stone, glass and white finishings. The room was big, and the shower was just amazing. All stone, with a giant shower head above, like standing in warm rain. Extremely comfortable bed. The bar and restaurant area is cool and trendy so I expected some kind of snooty attitude, but I found the entire experience very friendly. The location is the Lower East Side, which isn't for everyone, but I like the 'real' side of Manhattan and there are some gorgeous restaurants all around. On my next trip, I will book again for sure. as it was a great discovery.

Reviews.Title: “No respect”
Reviews.Author: Eastonbelmont
Reviews.Content: Do not stay... Club in hotel will keep you up all night. Communication is awful, had 30 different answers given to me to my one question. This place only pretends to be cool and hip. It is not.

Reviews.Title: “Like Sleeping in An Unfinished Basement”
Reviews.Author: PamelaVL
Reviews.Content: Boy, I love a cool hotel, hip as they come. Sadly the Thompson LES was less than a comfortable, friendly stay. The cold service were matched by the cold starkness of the rooms. I dunno, it was just trying too hard to be THAT SoHo hotel. It just got it wrong .. felt like the hotel was more about itself than its guests. Sorry, can't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: karynmurph
Reviews.Content: This is a classic example of a sexy hotel with sexy staff. If you want that, here you go. If you want customer service, look elsewhere. We arrived at 2:15pm after traveling in Thailand for 2 months. We were exhausted. One person was behind the counter. I waited with my backpack on my back (no bellman offered to take my bag) as two other parties checked in. When I got to the counter, the woman working (cold as ice) told me that our room was not ready. I asked her when it would be ready and she snapped, "3pm, that is check in time, after all". We left our bags and went to the second floor restaurant for lunch. At 3pm, we came back down to check in and surprise, surprise, our room was still not ready. We were not in our room until 3:45. We sat in the lobby for 45 minutes watching others check in. It was not a great way to start. Picky things about the room: -The toilet seat wouldn't stay up, it would close on my husband as he was peeing which is obviously a messy situation. -Their bath towels are tiny, when I wrapped it around myself after the shower, my butt hung out. Only one bathrobe per room and no slippers. -Our shower door was broken, wouldn't shut, the seal/hinge was off -Housekeeping "tidies up" your personal belongings every day, to me this just feels like someone has rifled through my belongings, I just want the room cleaned -Only sushi for food. I love sushi but my husband does not, so he had no options. -They charge $10 a day for internet. I strongly disagree with higher end hotels charging for internet, it's not costing them more per user, so charging more after you've already paid a lot for your room is an insult. However, if I am going to pay, I expect the internet to be fast. Their internet is not, we could not stream any video and websites loaded slowly. -Bedside lamps have no switch, you plug/unplug them, seemed strange. One of the most annoying things is the elevator key card situation. We were constantly missing our floor and watching the same thing happen to other people because the card reader wouldn't work properly. We rode up with an employee once who said the same, that it was always difficult and even she couldn't get it to work. Today, the icing on the dumb elevator cake happened to my husband when he got in from his lunch. All of the elevators were broken and he had to walk up the 6 flights of stairs to our room. Thank goodness we weren't on a higher floor. Our TV froze on a channel and a volume setting. We had to unplug it to turn it off. The craziest experience I had here was this afternoon, when I placed a room service order at 2:30pm. A woman answered the phone once I hit "restaurant" and took my room service order. She even answered a second time when I called back to ask for ice and said no problem. At 4pm, I called back to see where my order was, after all, the only thing they serve is sushi, how long can it take to send me some raw fish? The man I spoke to at 4pm said there were no open room service orders. I explained that I had given my order to a woman who answered at 2:30 and he said that there was no woman working. The order was completely lost. It was nuts. I called the manager, apologized and sent me my order for half off. The whole thing was just so odd. It felt like I was in the Twilight Zone. We are happy to be leaving this hotel early. Odd issues and overall, a cold staff. Great neighborhood, acceptable room, but nothing special about this operation and no one seems to care how your stay is.

Reviews.Title: “My new NYC go to”
Reviews.Author: Lalena24
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine a better place to stay! I've stayed in many NYC hotels and Thompson LES tops them all. First off, the LES is my fave area so it was a prime location to all my favorite spots. The metro stop is RIGHT there which is huge, a great corner bar (Bar Epstein) just a few steps away. The staff were incredible...so helpful, friendly, and somehow all good looking! I had the most amazing room with a view that would bring a tear to your eye. The room was comfortable, clean, and the design details were wonderful...from the lightbox headboard to the dark hardwood floors, the floor to ceiling windows and cement ceiling, I loved it all. If you like funky, modern architecture, artistic detailing, a stylish but comfortable feel and great location you can't beat this spot. AND it was one of the better priced hotels I found in the city! Thanks Thompson LES for an amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Both Loved It For Different Reasons”
Reviews.Author: travelgalcalgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mid-20s son and we both thought the hotel was clean, stylish and good attitude by the staff. My son loved it because there's young folks here and in the neighborhood, tiny bars and great pizza nearby. I loved it because I've been to NYC a few times already and now I like to spend time getting to know a neighborhood and the LowerEastSide has a lot of history and some charming restaurants. Subway stop less than a block away. We'd both go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Wallp
Reviews.Content: Nice, spacious rooms, very good location for downtown/LES exploration. Got an extremely smelly smokingroom upon arrival, even though we had booked a non-smoking room. No chance for a new room same day, got moved eventually late next day - resulting in smelly clothes and bad sleep. Also negative; no free wifi, expensive inroom movies ($15), poor room-service selection. Front desk very visually attractive (think Rihanna), but not able to give understandable advise or appreciate complaints. The hotel oversells it's coolness; it's basically just a good hotell at a very good location with somewhat cooler rooms than the ordinary chain hotell.

Reviews.Title: “New favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: diem_perdidi
Reviews.Content: Love the location in the LES, staff are great ,especially the door/bellman. Restaurant is good, service excellent and I have booked suites at this hotel twice at a very good rate - sign up for their email notifications. Can be a bit noisy as the room doors can slam very loudly, but that is a minor kvetch.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny modern room with floor to ceiling windows”
Reviews.Author: oaklandbrownbear
Reviews.Content: Interesting neighborhood away from Times Square Modern design Floor to ceiling windows Tiny, cozy room Cool, urban feel Room service sushi

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool rooms pity about the cold service”
Reviews.Author: KKKRS
Reviews.Content: The bold industrial decor of the room is very contemporary ad won't suit everyone's taste but if you enjoy design or fashion, this would be a good choice. It's clear from the other guests staying here that it was the choice of the young and hip. The floor to ceiling windows are striking and provide an interesting view of NYC. The bed was comfy and the sheets were a nice thread count. There are monumental backlit white boxes with botanical themes printed on them above each bed providing a focal point for the room and interesting lighting for romantic moments. I stayed in three different rooms and found them all quiet. The thermostat worked well. The 'rain' head in the shower is another feature although it was so high tech we couldn't get it to work at will. The shower is huge - definitely enough room for two. The bathroom is stocked with organic toiletries by Bigelow. I spent my entire stay there smelling like lavender and peppermint. We had fun in the bar on the second floor - there's all kinds of random modernist furniture to roll around on as you get drunk on overpriced drinks. I had the room service breakfast -$48US for two greasy pork sausages, oily eggs, hash browns, oj and coffee. I ate about 1/3 of it. Also they didn't seem to want to take my room service order because I prepaid my stay. I had a lot of troubles with service at the hotel. I think I got poorer service because I prepaid and got a discount through an internet booking site. The room I got was massive and cost about 1/3 of what it should have so I think the staff thought I had gotten my value for money already. For example my television didn't work and it took ten phone calls to get some action on that. I was sick and just wanted to lie in bed and watch TV. That doesn't seem like such an incredible request but the front of house people rolled their eyes, looked at each other and failed to act time after time. The Thomson is a cool hotel in a fantastic location (public transport is across the road, you can walk to the East Village, Chinatown, Brooklyn). Having said that it feels like you are staying in money making machine. The staff are a bit cold but just give it back to them - they work in a hotel after all, not in the fashion industry

Reviews.Title: “A Cool experience (with a colder female receptionist)”
Reviews.Author: LittlePumpkin
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in the Thompson LES. Had been watching their website for a couple of months prior to our trip and noticed fluctuations in pricing. Initially the superior queen room was $379 per night. I contacted the hotel directly and they offered me a rate of $300 per night - which I declined. Just before Christmas their rate dropped to $179 per night - so we opted for an upgrade to Studio King Suite for $239 per night - good value considering the basic room was $379 the previous week! Checkin was a sullen, cold experience with a female receptionist who didnt speak or engage with us - apart from asking us to hand over Credit Card details, never gave any eye contact and her diva like persona was the coldest experience I have ever had checking in anywhere in the world. She handed over our keycard without a word of what floor we were situated on, directions to our room or any basic information one might expect on check in. Think this 'lady' would prefer to be the other side of the counter or perhaps on a catwalk! Not a good career choice as a receptionist methinks!! Who hires these people? The delightful doorman escorted us and our baggage to our room - talked us through the basics and more than made up for the diva-like experience we had with his sullen colleague. All other staff we encountered were polite, courteous and efficient. The Room: Wow. Initially didnt know what to make of the room. The bare concrete, dark wood, mirrored glass walls were stark - however the luxurious elements over-rode my initial concerns. Within minutes I loved this room and it proved to be one of the most relaxing, comfortable rooms I have stayed in. Our room overlooked the pool and Orchard Street (no city view) but it proved to be a great location insofar as we had no noise pollution during the night. The hotel is situated in the Lower East Side - a wonderful, vibrant area with a plethora of good restaurants, bars etc. To be honest, this hotel may not suit a lot of people, it is portraying itself as a cool, trendy place (it is) and wouldnt be a place I would recommend to my parents. Actually as a 40something year old, I felt a little 'aged' at times. Neither would I recommend it for families (dont know if they supply cribs etc and didnt see any information regarding same) One point deducted due to our experience with "La Diva" on reception, apart from that we had a fab time, in a fab hotel, in a wonderful location. Would definately stay here again, provided I got a good rate and would definately recommend to anyone looking for a modern, edgy, hip, different experience. Just keep an eye on their rates to bag a good deal

Reviews.Title: “Loud Nightclub noise from the 7th floor...”
Reviews.Author: Vinn25
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Saturday night on the 9th floor, with views of the projects across the road. The main problem was that the nightclub is situated on the 7th floor, also it protrudes out from the building so that it is underneath the windows of the 8th floor rooms and higher. We might as well have sleeping in the nightclub as the soundproofing is so bad. When I called to request another room, I was told that they were booked up and there was nothing they could do except offer me some EAR PLUGS!!!!!!!! I thought she was joking, but then she proceeded to become rude and snotty on the phone basically telling me I should just suck it up! She did say she would ask the DJ to turn the bass down, but that never happened. Then at around 10 minutes after midnight, the phone rang with the front desk lady telling me she had good news, that the owners son would not be using his room tonight and we could move into it away from the noise... I think she was expecting me to be grateful, having just arrived in New York off a flight from Australia I certainly was not expecting a hotel room that I could not sleep in due to the noise from the nightclub, and having to deal with a snotty receptionist who forgot why she is working in a hotel. Oh and finally, to top it all off, at around 4am the fire alarm went off for about 15 minutes, a voice on the intercom said it was a glitch in the system. Fun times all round.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location Real New York”
Reviews.Author: Moonta
Reviews.Content: Check in was rather slow but given it's location and it being peak holiday time it was understandable. Staff were all fantastic and everything we requested was seen to. We stayed 2 nights on arrival and then decided to return for another before departing as location and experience was just to good. Only advise if taking a taxi to the airport from the property have they call and book it in instead of flagging it on the street. We assumed it was booked and lost bags in the cab which have never been found. If it had been booked we could have tracked the cab. It gets a very young and trendy crowd in it's club and bar but this did not affect our stay one bit. Rooms great size for a NYC hotel. Walking distance to Soho amongst other great areas and fab local shopping and restaurants on it's door step. Do stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View!!”
Reviews.Author: kremer30
Reviews.Content: If you want to have a romantic stay with your partner in New York, then this is THE place to be!! We stayed on the 16th floor and with the view on the south/west/southwest side (cornerview...) and it was AMAZING!!! Even my partner (who had lived in New York for over 5 years) said it was amazing (I'm just a "normal" Dutch guy...)! The friendliness of the staff could be a little bit better (depends who you're dealing with...), but the room definately made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “A great find, too bad prices have already gone up”
Reviews.Author: brazilianwanderlust
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip in April 2009, exactly as the credit crunch was spreading doom all over Europe and the US. So I guess this was the reason why I got a room here for a little more than 100 dollars! I could not believe the price, as NY is notoriously expensive year-round. I had never stayed in the Lower East Side and I loved it. The hotel was brand new and the room was excellent, even though it was probably of a lower standard in the hotel, as it had no balcony and no bathtub. It was very spacious for any city, even more so for NY standards. Too bad a few months later prices shot up again, as I tried to recommend this hotel to a few friends, but they were unable to find the "bargain" I was so enthusiastically talking about. A great option, though, if you like to stay downtown, and noteworthy because it has an outdoor pool, which can be great in the scalding NY summer. Just to finish: it is a trendy boutique hotel, but I've seen fake ones, and this didn't seem like one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Tries too hard to be trandy”
Reviews.Author: foodshooter
Reviews.Content: I have been here twice now, but probably won't stay again. There is nothing really bad about this hotel, it's just that I felt like a fish out of water. I hate to complain about hotels clientele, but both times I have been here I have been met with rude behavior, snobbery, impatience, arrogance and bad manners. This is not from the staff, but from other guests. It is a trendy hotel and as a result I feel that a lot of the guests feel they are a cut above other people. I have experienced pushing and jostling at check in, noisy behavior from neighboring rooms, people cutting in front of me in the line for the taxi. I have never experienced this kind of behavior at other hotels and I travel for business about 30 times a year with about 15 of those trips to NYC. I want to like the hotel, but with customers like the ones I have described I don't think i'll be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy!!! Major oversight on design of slamming doors!!!”
Reviews.Author: playa102
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I an compelled to put the word out there for noise sensitive people like myself(though the slamming doors are so loud that you don't have to be particularly sensitive to hear them). i say unfortunately because most other aspects of the hotel seemed satisfactory and I have stayed at other Thompson hotels and thought that they were a "better" brand so to speak. This hotel came off feeling cheapish and clueless. Now I totally get the comparison that another reviewer made when comparing it to the quality of the Royalton. The first thing a hotel needs to deliver is the comfort of it's guests especially regarding a good night's sleep in the privacy of their room no matter what the hotel may or may not deliver in regards to other amenities that go on in the lobby,etc. I asked for a quiet room upon check in after reading a couple of reviews regarding the bar noise.The front desk person adknowledged the potential for noise from the bar in the room e were previously assigned 6th floor and switched our room to the 4th floor,away from the bar which I believe is on seven. All was good ,nice room,we head out to eat drink,etc. Upon returning to the hotel and settling in for bed I started to hear large banging noises sporadically,they sounded like large crates of liquid(bottles?) being dropped on our ceiling but i knew we weren't under the bar so I called the front desk after the fourth noise and mentioned what was going on...he seemed as baffled as I was but said he would investigate. Many hours went by,the noise continued,I slept through it as much as one could,sort of, you know...when you are so tired at one point you could sleep at a bus station or airport(this is how I fell asleep both nights). It wasn't until morning and we left our room that I realized the "slamming "noise was actually the heavy doors to the rooms that have no hinges(or not slow enough ones) and slam shut whenever anyone enters or exits their room(no fault of the guest who is oblivious to this unless trying to sleep),and I mean "LOUDLY" as there was a long hallway between our door and where we actually slept and I could not hear elevator shafts,voices or any other noises. This is such a SHAME as the rooms are otherwise well insulated(no street noise,couldn't hear adjacent guests,etc.)and I am writing this in hopes that the hotel manager/owners /architects will see this and do something about it. I mentioned it several times and again upon check out and the staff,while polite and considerate, I realize now might have been playing"dumb" since there is not much they can do about it anyway(in the moment).I would think they would want upper management to know.Nobody adknowledged being aware of this issue.Upon check out the young lady commented"well I wonder who was slamming their doors" and I said nobody"they slam themselves shut". This is a hotel I would have returned to if not for the needless noise issue.I really liked the location and the hotel seemed adequate otherwise...I'm not the type to complain over petty issues and in fact only write reviews when I have something really good to say about a place that I would like to share with fellow travelers. Needless to say we had to endure a second night of the same which was sort of depressing going back to the hotel after a nice dinner knowing you were going to encounter more "slamming".It's really loud because the doors are so heavy,sounds like a BANK VAULT closing shut each time.Or a JAIL CELL DOOR.Needless to say I had many opportunities to analyze the sound. In addition to the inner doors slamming,we also had to endure the jolting of the balcony door of the room adjacent to us in the wind...I only mentioned it to the front desk when we were rifled out of bed at 3 a. m, and had to go down to the lobby in our pajamas after a false fire alarm...what timing...just as I was finally getting to sleep! Murphy's Law,I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great value, clean, sleek, a fun place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: pleadeas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Dec 25 to 27th, king studio room. Plenty of space, probably 350 sq feet. Clean, new, bathroom is great, shower is large with great shower head and water pressure. Bed is comfortable, great view from floor to ceiling windows, however we were on the 11th floor, facing north, and the Ludlow apartment building blocked some of the view. Staff is great, young and hip, but attentive, they know how to run a boutique hotel. Great local in LES, walking to LES shops and restaurants, and walking to Soho. All around great experience. Looked at the Bowery king room too, and went by and saw the room, nice, but the Tompson is much newer and larger with a much nicer and more modern bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “An acceptable fall-back choice”
Reviews.Author: Misterphoto
Reviews.Content: Rate and Value: Found a $300 rate on Quikbook, first week of December, heavy tourist week, hard to find anything decent in NYC under $450. Room and Property: Room was miniscule, only slightly bigger than the queen bed. The rooms shown on the website must be the biggest suites. Clean and very modern. Bed on very low platform. Floor to ceiling window gave dramatic view but felt a bit exhibitionistic. Not for those with a fear of heights. Small desk and chair, no dresser, no proper closet, no iron. No free wireless. Nice modern bathroom with rain shower head, shower causes water to splash all over bathroom floor, small scratchy towels, no hook or towel bar to hang wet towels. Smallish lobby with big restaurant and lounge on 2nd floor. Service: Young, eager, not especially professional. Neighborhood: A bit out of the way, but interesting, lots of trendy shops and cafes in the mix with a few old neighborhood shops. Absolutely hopping at night, crowds on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: jetlaggad
Reviews.Content: Not a big fan of boutique or trendy hotels , but was booked here for a few days by clients. This was really a very positive surprise and experience , much better than other trendy hotels i have stayed in . Located in a great neighborhood with lots of local flair and history, plenty of coffee places , restaurants and old famous delicatessens - have to spend the weekend next time. The service is excellent , from the doormen who were very helpful and knowledgeable about the area, to the check in staff. The bar is nice if you can use the outside deck , inside not so fun. The restaurant has a good menu , but questionable lay out and decor . Rooms are comfortable , a bit on the dark side for me , beds are very comfortable, slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Not a flawless stay @ the Thompson LES but manager handled it well...”
Reviews.Author: Mayfair101
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked the thompson hoping to have a romantic weekend in NYC but when we arrived at 5pm and were told that the room was not ready, i thought this is off to a bad start. The manager apologized for the inconvenience and offered us a drink at the bar while we waited. It took about 20 min to get our room so we enjoyed our drink while we waited... Once we got the room, we were happy with the overall look. Its very trendy, dark, and romantic. Also, quite new which is good. The next day, we left the hotel around 9am and returned around 5pm. To our surprise, the room had not been cleaned. We called the front desk and the manager who offered us the drink was working so i informed her of the situation. They sent us fresh towels right away and i requested to have the room cleaned once we left the room for our dinner. This was done. Besides these two incidents, we liked the hotel overall. It has a nice look to it, nice spa and gym, and the manager did handle the situation appropriately in my opinion. I would give the hotel another chance... Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing. Amature front desk help.”
Reviews.Author: infomaninc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I go to NYC at least twice a year for a little R&R. Despite some negative reviews, I booked the Thompson LES in the hopes that my experience would be without issues. I called the hotel directly (a month prior to my visit) to make my reservation. I requested an early check-in and a high floor knowing that people complained abouth the noise from the 7th floor bar. The day we were checking in, I called the hotel to confirm and ask about the early check it. I was told I could not check in until 3pm because the hotel was booked solid. That was fine. My wife and I kept ourselved busy and arrived at the hotel at 4pm. Our room wasn't ready so they offered us a drink at the bar and an upgraded room (from studio suite to 1 bedroom suite). The room was nice, the balcony was cool, but we were on the 3rd floor directly above the lobby bar and it was loud. I would have rather had the smaller room I asked for on a higher floor, but I let it go. At 11am before we checkd out I called the front desk to get my car from the garage. I was told it would take 20 minutes and it took AN HOUR AND A HALF! I was told the hotel was very busy, there were a lot of guests checking out, blah blah blah. Give me a break. I The manager was nice enough to take the parking off my bill, but the whole experience was disappointing. We always stay at the Royalton on 44th St and will do so in the future. If you want to stay at a great hotel with unbeliveable rooms and service try the Royalton. You will be much better off.

Reviews.Title: “A Life-Saver!”
Reviews.Author: TessaWainscott
Reviews.Content: I came here at 1 am after checking out of a bad hotel nearby...the staff was great, the lobby was beautiful, they gave me the kind of room I requested with a window that opened for fresh air, the room was stylish and roomy and clean...very nice. There was a mini-bar, a safe, amenities (no shower caps, though) -- all at a good price. I recommend this hotel, but parking is difficult in this neighborhood and the nearby lots are pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Lower East Side”
Reviews.Author: h3m4l
Reviews.Content: Me & my girlfriend stayed here for a friends wedding and what an experience. We took a Red Eye from LA to NY and had arrived at the hotel at 8am. Our room wasn't ready so we went sightseeing and were ensured our room would be ready by the afternoon. We arrived back at 6pm & our room wasn't ready to my annoyance. We were given a large suite on floor 15 with the best view of the NY skyline & an amazing balcony. The room was exquisite, clean, roomy, great walk in shower & the best comfy bed I have slept in ever. The staff were friendly especially the doormen were by all the ladies in the hotel would gladly stop & stare at them...hahahaha. Location is right next to China town, Little Italy, Soho, great restaurants & bars in the vicinity & great Mediterranean cuisine round the corner from the hotel for a nice kebab at 2am. The hotel made all the guests feel welcome & friendly and also a fantastic place to meet the odd celebrity...I had the honour of meeting Phil Jackson (LA Lakers head coach) in the hotel lift...very friendly & yes my girlfriend went crazy when I actually managed to get an autograph for her addressed in her name. Overall if I am ever back in NY I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super trendy and stylish, but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Pysiu
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel but you have to like that kind of style. My boss for instance didn't like it that much becaus ehe likes the traditional design and couldn't make the half of the things to work :-). I found it fabulous! The design is very modern and chic. The hotel definitely has a character, which I very much appreciate. It is located in the hip Lower East Side full of bars, restaurants, artsy shops and more. I was very pleased with the customer service. Everytime I asked for something I got it in no time. The bed was extremely cmfortable with heavenl soft sheets - big plus! Batroos was large and had Bigolow toiletries - nice! This hotel is expensive hoever so I was bit disappointed that you had to pay separately for Internet ($10) and breakfast ($17), while in Europe these things come for free in majority of hotels. Oh, the food in the hotel was very good to and the bar on the 7th floor with a terrace overlooking Manhattan was super fun too! I will definitley gp back there again.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST”
Reviews.Author: flycarrie
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had in New York. I travel about 50 nights a year and have stayed in many New York hotels have never had a worse experience. We arrived at the hotel about 30 minutes before check-in and our room was not ready, but could upgrade for more money if we wanted a room early. We declined, we were already paying over $400 a night, and wanted to get out into the city, so we had them hold our luggage and came back at 5:00pm to check-in. We booked a non-smoking room and was given a room on the 8th floor that smelled like smoke and had cigarette butts on the roof below the window. I called down to the front desk and asked for a different room. The reply was is it really that bad? Can't you live with it? I said no, I want a room that doesn't reek like smoke. She said she would check and call back in a couple of minutes later. 15 minutes later when the bellman showed up with our luggage and still no phone call back, we decided just to go back downstairs. The bellman then asked why we were changing rooms and I said because it smells like smoke. He said, well, you are on the smoking floor in a smoking room. We get back downstairs and am told we can upgrade to a non-smoking room. I said we booked a non-smoking room. I was then informed it was a preference not a guarantee. I asked if he had any non-smoking in the category we booked available and he said maybe if I came back at 7:00pm. I said, no worries, I will just go to another hotel. Now it was, "wait just a minute, OK I have a non-smoking in your category". Wow, just amazing in 2 minutes it was now available. The room was the smallest room even for New York standards, smaller the a cabin on a cruise ship! The front desk staff acted like they were working on commission and tried to get us to pay for an upgrade several times and try to get us to pay for things we were not interested in. We were there for one night for an event, that I was then late for by the time we finally got into our room, over an hour to get a room after all the mess. All this for $400 a night! There are so many hotels in New York that the rooms are decent size, a front desk staff that is pleasant and helpful and not there to gouge you, and you should consider any other hotel before booking. For the price you should have accommodations of a 4 star hotel. This is a 2 star hotel that is putting more money into marketing then into the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, inexperienced night manager”
Reviews.Author: Yokerite
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the LES Thompson for 6 nights. Very pleased with the room, I had requested a nice view but it was of side street. After arriving we unpacked and went out to see Times Sq. Came back exhausted and got ready for bed only to find that my half of the bed was WET. Yes, a previous guest had urinated in the bed. The manager came to inspect and was more interested in a quest who was arriving at 5am the next morning. He suggested we repack all our belongings and move to another room 5 floors below. It was now 11.30pm and we had been on the go since 4am British time. I felt this was unreasonable so I suggested he could swap the mattresses and bedding around. He hadn't thought of that. I don't know how it wasn't noticed by housekeeping. We heard no more about it. I wrote to the head office but didn't receive a reply. However, other than that we were happy with the hotel. In our next DC hotel we had a mix up which I didn't even report to anyone, another guest did, and we were surprised to find wine, cheese and crackers in our room with a lovely card full of apologies. Now that's nice!! I would recommend this hotel but not the best position for 1st time in NYC, a bit removed from the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerfromAus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Thompson LES after agonising on which hotel to stay at and best location. Friends had said that the area wasnt great. I took a chance and loved the hotel. I got a great price on tablet.com and upgraded to a suite for a good price. The staff were great - friendly and helpful. Certainly not too cool for school. My room was modern but with character. I cant say anything bad about the hotel or location. Have weekend brunch around the corner at Prune and make sure you do the Tenement Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Hip, Trendy, Modern, How does this thing work?”
Reviews.Author: turquoisebuyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Thompson and enjoyed our stay very much. We are in our late 50's and appreciate art, design and architecture so we were excited to stay here. Check-in was a breeze, very pleasant, professional staff, stunning room with two double beds, very cool bath and shower. Our room 1411 was just steps off the elevator through a door with two rooms off a small hall. We smelled very strong stale cigarette smoke in this small hallway and mentioned it to the bellman. He offered to move us to another room if we were bothered. Upon opening our door we found the room to be beautiful and the air fresh. Later that night and on two other occasions a very strong odor of cigarettes filled our room. One night, around 4am it was strong enough to wake us up. At checkout we complimented the staff on the hotel and mentioned the smoke. The response from the young man at the front desk was "sorry about that." He wasn't surprised and offered no explanation. Positives: Beautiful nice staff large, clean rooms Room ready on time flat screen TV nice bar on 7th floor great views Negatives: couldn't find any movie channels $10.00 charge for internet (cheapens the experience) no ice machines (you have to order ice from room service) elevators not working for an hour so we climbed to the 7th floor bar to wait Never figured out how the remote control worked Never figured out how to use the hand held shower Finally figured out the main shower controls Had to ask for a lamp (promptly delivered) The room so dark we had to use a flashlight to find things in our suitcases. Very dim lighting. Shower and bath area had frosted glass walls and you could definitely see a person in the shower from the bedroom. I've been told there may have been a button to push to fog up the glass walls however there were no instructions. All in all I would recommend this hotel and we will happily stay there again. Next time we will be calling the front desk for instructions.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better. (So should the hotel.)”
Reviews.Author: kategem
Reviews.Content: First, the good things... the rooms are big. The showers are huge and walk in, the toiletries are CO Bigelow, the bed is comfortable. The location isn't bad, smack bang on the edge of the lower east side. Most of the staff are lovely, especially the doormen. It's very very clean. Now, the bad. The lifts are always packed, usually with staff, and you have to use the room key to activate them, and the room keys seem to have a mind of their own and need constant re-programming. The only room service is delicious-but-rich-and-quickly-boring food from Shang. The air conditioner is noisier than a Mustang '67. (Seriously, whoever organised the air conditioners here should be shot.) The (paddling) pool area is full of cool, pointless people. Several of the more senior staff are smarmy. The TV seems odd and slow, and there are no in-house movies or HBO on demand or a DVD or iPod. We won't stay here again, put it that way. There are too many good hotels in NY to have to put up with one that has so many faults - even if it is stylish and permanently on sale on quikbook.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: traveldudey
Reviews.Content: The positives: The staff was friendly and helpful. The room had a comfortable bed, a large flatscreen TV, and the large rainfall shower was fantastic. The hotel's location is great for exploring the lower east side which is a very interesting neighborhood. The negatives: Some of the room furnishings had a very cheap appearance including the fake wood paneling and the sectional sofa in the sitting area of the room. The sofa was dirty and very uncomfortable to sit in since the back was not a cushion but made out of hard material. Also, the room was dark. You could turn on every light in the room and it would still be dark. While this created a "hip" vibe there are times when you just need some light. To sum up I would say that while the hotel is nice I think there are better values in NYC for the price. So unless you have a strong desire to stay on the lower east side you may want to consider other hotel options.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: dfctrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night...wished it could have been longer. For me, the most important thing about staying in a hotel is that you feel COMFORTABLE. Well, we had comfort with 1) Great, supportive bed...slept like a baby! 2) Friendly, welcoming, unassuming staff...no attitude! 3) Room service delivered promptly and cheerfully, 4) Clean and contemporary bedroom with awesome floor to ceiling city view, and a bathroom with refreshing shower set-up (with "rain" and hand-held options.) I will definitely return here on future visits to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “December 30 - January 5th - LES was just Meh.”
Reviews.Author: Chocokide
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to spend New Years in NYC. Obviously there are 100's of choices available in NYC, but the LES is limited for well priced options. Here's what I found as drawbacks: 1.) Found a pair of eyelashes (yes, sticky glue fake eyelashes) affixed to the black lacquer bed when we arrived. Not a big enough deal to call housekeeping, but still uber gross to have to get tp and throw them out. It was like the bed was staring at me. 2.) A prior guest left what I can only assume was toothpaste on the back of the door and housekeeping did not remove it during our entire stay. 3.) Bed had a ledge of sorts on the back (facing window) that had mounds of dust on it - stayed there for all nights of our trip. 4.) Fire alarm went off on night/early morning of day 4 (I believe) and upon return to our room door was unlocked/open. Ran around to make sure we hadn't been robbed and luckily we weren't. Highly annoying because we were tramping down the stairs from a higher floor and did not receive any direction from staff. Finally decided to go back to room when alarm went off and didn't see or hear even ONE other person. Guess it was a false alarm, but firetrucks did arrive and could see them quickly leave. 5.) Front desk called me one evening when I was out enjoying dinner and asked some random question - tried to get more info, but I guess they realized their error and HUNG UP on me. 6.) Only 1 elevator appeared to work. 7.) Not really a negative for me, since it was NYE and I like to party with the best of them - but upon arriving back to our hotel around 3 AM on NYE found random drunken females riding in elevator trying to get off on the 7th floor I believe. Once we arrived back to our room we could hear a party going on. Again ONLY happened on NYE, but I can only imagine how annoying that would have been on any other night. 8.) Shower doors were ever so loud and made a huge slamming sound that would make you believe the glass was about to burst on top of your head. You could also hear this sound from other rooms. Positives 1.) Hotel is newer than most other hotels in LES and for what we paid well worth it.. 2.) See negative #7 - could be positive if you are looking to party 3.) Elevator required a key card to get off on your floor. 4.) Subway stop across the street 5.) Other than #5 all contact with employees was nice and I noticed one of the doorguys from 6 Columbus was now working here. Actually the employees were super nice - so double plus. 6.) Our room was absolutely amazing. We had a corner room which if you stood on the bed (how I came to notice #3 above negative) you could see the Manhattan and Brooklyn bridges - or perhaps just the Manhattan bridge. Have to check pictures. Awesome - awesome view of lower Manhattan and if I pressed my cheek against the floor to ceiling windows I could see the ESB. 7.) Other than slamming shower door from above NEVER heard a peep from any other guests. I only saw one other person on our floor the entire time we were there, so I'm not sure if the hotel was at capacity, but I would assume not considering the bargain basement rates this hotel had even the day before we arrived. I didn't try the restaurant, but I loved this restaurant one block south of LES on Allen street called Kampuchea. It's a Cambodian restaurant - yummy. Sugar next door was also very tasty - ask the guy why they don't have strawberries hehe. Whole Foods is about 2 blocks away and has many great options and a cool place you can sit and eat and enjoy street views. There's a crepe place a few blocks away that you should try (but only order one) I suggest a desert crepe. Pianos was fun in the LES as was the burlesque show across the street from Kampuchea. So all in all - not sure if my negatives (mainly surrounding housekeeping) would keep me from recommending the hotel to a friend - but, I probably wouldn't stay there again because I got the eery feeling that in a few months the housekeeping issues would turn into maintenance issues and the whole place would be a dump with great views. Actually I am headed back to NYC for Labor Day and I didn't even look at Thompson LES rates, because come to remember it the bed staring at me was just too gross and everytime I see a black lacquer bed now I'll just think it's winking at me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMancs
Reviews.Content: We ( 2 twenty somethings and Mum!) stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in August, getting a last minute discount with GTA hotels. On arrival they were overbooked so we were given the pent house for a night, which was absolutely amazing with fantastic views. The next day the manager couldn't be more helpful showing us round different room options and upgrading us to a King Suite which had plenty of room for 3. The location is fantastic with lots of nice bars, delis and restaurants and very close to a subway station. The staff were really helpful and friendly, and the rooms clean and spacious. The bar is definately worth going to, and the gym is good. We would stay here again, and will go back to this area next time we are in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & classy with a good vibe all around”
Reviews.Author: highzee
Reviews.Content: Very impressive building! I didn't come across any parts of it that weren't done well (and believe me, I looked). The place had nice finishes all-around and just had an overall classy vibe to it. The moment I got there, I said that I was gonna write a review on here about it! The place straddles the line of laid back vibe and party hotel very well. I was in town for a conference, so I wanted some decent rest, and found no problems being totally relaxed there. I was on the 5th floor and I could occasionally hear some dishes clanking from the restaurant, but nothing overly excessive. Almost no traffic noise from a relatively busy part of the city. At the same time, if I had been up for a party, this would be the place to find one. The place is quite trendy and in a pretty lively neighborhood, so I could see some people feeling a bit out of place there. The staff (and patrons) were all amazing so if you're sometimes uncomfortable being in trendy places, just keep an open mind about it all, and I'm sure you'll find everyone absolutely charming.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel but needs to work out a few things...”
Reviews.Author: ndivaday
Reviews.Content: Perhaps we were expecting more out of the Thompson LES since a few friends who had recommended this mini-boutique chain of hotels had raved about it. Not to say we were disappointed, just thought that they need to work out a few kinks. We booked a King Junior Suite. Upon arrival, we went through a fairly smooth check-in process (the doormen at this hotel are top-notch by the way, but I'll explain that later). The room itself was spacious for NYC hotel (although in any other city, our room would be considered an average size King room), nice amenities (C.O. Bigelow bath products, beautiful soft Italian sheets and a very relaxing waterfall shower head). I'm not a big fan of the current trend in hip boutique hotels towards having platform beds but I have to say, this one was one of the more comfortable ones that I've slept in. Our room was on the 7th floor - right across from the "lounge/patio/bar". As the night wore on (we were weary travelers who just wanted to sleep), the music from the bar just got louder, the people going in and out of this bar more and more loud and drunk. Also, our room (#703) was situated directly across from an exit door of the lounge that was constantly being used by the bar patrons. I ended up calling the front desk and spoke to the night Manager (Alfie) who was as helpful as possible but didn't have another King room available on another floor until the morning (they had a room with 2 Queens but my husband is 6'4" and that wouldn't have worked for him). We decided to make the most of the night (well, what was left of it) and would move in the morning. If you find yourself during check-in being given Room 703, try and have it changed unless you are okay with a sleepless hotel night. In the end, they moved us to Room 1103 - a lovely Junior King Suite room on the 11th floor with a beautiful view and most importantly we were able to sleep soundly through the night. The Wifi was down throughout our stay (although we were charged on our bill, they did adjust it ) and during our check out the Front Desk's IT system was down as well so we were unable to receive a copy of our bill. Overall, the staff was friendly (and beautiful - something to be expected). The Doormen however should receive special kudos. They were helpful with making sure our rental car wasn't ticketed when we first arrived since we had to park in front of the hotel for about a half an hour, and they were just great at always making sure our bags were taken care of (luggage and shopping!). My husband (who is less the hotel snob than I am...but that's only because I travel for a living and stay in a ton of hotels) loved the place and would highly recommend the place. Me, I liked it too, would recommend it for its location (right in the heart of the Lower East Side, close to the great shopping and restaurant districts of Soho, Nolita, East Village and LES). Conveniently located across the street from an F subway stop that easily takes you uptown or to Brooklyn.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: nflores07070
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to crash in the city for our 1 yr anniversary even though we only live about 8 minutes from Manhattan. We chose the Thompson LES because we wanted to be downtown and also had heard about the rooftop pool and the weather was great. The staff at the front desk was so accommodating and treated us very well. They also upgraded our suite to another room and made us feel extra special. The room was incredible, letâ€™s just put it this way it was the Penthouse so I have nothing bad to say at all. Nevertheless, the pool was nice and great when it was 90 degrees. The bar was a cool place to hang out at night, and even with so many places to have drinks in the city I thought the open air bar was fantastic. We are planning on going back, and the hotel is a great choice. Yes it is modern and very typical trendy NYC. So if that is not what you are looking for, keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Stiff Back But A Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: Princess13Cleveland
Reviews.Content: Thompson LES has a very modern look and is clean. Additionally, the front desk was super accomidating and went out of their way to give us directions and assistance. Christian, the "doorman" rocked! He gave us so much help and being a native, had wonderful tips, conversation and very quick service. The food and drinks were good, not stellar. The rooms are small (stayed on the seventh floor) but were always attended to by the cleaning service.
