It is housed in a fun neighborhood; Soho and all the unique shops are close by, (we suggest hitting Rice to Riches on Spring St., a delicious rice pudding only place, for a yummy and unusual dessert experience). Only real draw backs were the pool because it was disorganized in regards to no towels, minimal lounging areas and closed bar. Also the bed STUNK! Horrible sleep and only a few inches off the ground-very uncomfortable and not for anybody with back issues! Overall for the price, its a good hotel experience because the hipness factor is not sacrificed for the cost; during our three day stay we ran into Pete Wentz and Ashlee Simpson, several famous football players and a Vouge photoshoot was hosted in the lobby. A customer can get a true, well-rounded New York experience at Thompson LES.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: missteejay
Reviews.Content: Honestly, after reading the reviews here I was a little nervous about staying at this hotel. To me, there's nothing worse than paying a bunch of money for bad service. But I found a rate of $120/night through Quickbook and figured I could suck it up for all the money I was saving. I didn't have to! We were put in a great room on the 15th floor with a fabulous view. The floor to ceiling windows made the decently sized room feel even bigger. Seriously, by NY standards, this room was not that small. The staff was friendly and the location can't be beat. My only regret is that I didn't have time to check out the pool. We skipped the restaurant because of all the great options surrounding the hotel and the "club" was definitely not our scene. But I honestly have no complaints about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you're a light sleeper, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Double Scrutiny
Reviews.Content: I just completed a four-night stay at this hotel. In general, it presented good value for the money. The problem was room noise. And, it was not the expected room noise. Surprisingly, street noise was not the problem, unlike in many NYC hotels. I was on the 6th floor and really could not hear any street noise. BUT: The walls are like paper; any conversation in the next room could be heard in mine. When the phone next door rang, it sounded like it was ringing in my room. My neighbors kept odd hours. Neighbor conversations could be heard---loudly---at 5am and at 2am. So, while the hotel offers good value, if you draw a neighbor that keeps odd hours, be prepared to "join" every conversation in the neighboring room. I would not return for these reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but very good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: LuxPlorer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Thompson LES in June 2009 for three nights in a Studio King Suite for $216/night w/ breakfast and late check-out. Room was very nice, modern decor, spacious for NYC. Hotel has a cool, hip vibe, located in a fun neighborhood. Service was friendly and mostly good, although minor quibble in that maid service was very late one day (5 pm). Hipness went a bit overboard in the gym in that the low, recessed lighting is kind of annoying during workout. Good location to midtown and downtown and all the fun places in between. Bottom line though, at the price, it is absolutely a steal given the high quality of the room (unlike other reviewers I slept great in the bed and had zero noise issues on my floor (9th)). Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “terrible bed ,great staff”
Reviews.Author: foodie_on_the_run
Reviews.Content: The decor has a mod cool factor .The staff extremely accommodating ,warm & inviting.Then we checked into our room .Very Very small.,Bed futon like just elevated inches off the floor.Rain shower no tub bathroom. No fridge just some mini bar box that never gets cold. The worst sleep because the bed was so uncomfortable. The pool was not set up even though it was hot out.No towels,or beds on top of the lounge chairs. Wouldn't rush back to spite being in a cool neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Small but sweet-ish.”
Reviews.Author: superstardj
Reviews.Content: Small reception, friendly staff, tiny rooms - well enough equipped but I just found my room too cramped, with nowhere to put your stuff. I was only there one night, if I'd been there for longer (or with someone else) I would have found it very claustrophobic. Like most Thompson hotels, it's very dark and cool with nice trendy amenities in the shower, but does lack some of the services you'd find in a Hyatt or Sheraton. Form over function, a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rocko_J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LES for 3 days as part of our honeymoon. First impressions were not great, as the entrance is very understated and the reception is very small. We stayed in a King Suite and were very impressed. The room was large and very modern. The Floor to ceiling windows let all the light in (although they did not open). The bed was fantastic, with the best linen I have ever slept in. Bathroom is roomy and again very modern. The shower is amazing and the bath is big enough for a family (but that would be wierd). The area itself is great, with a GREAT breakfast place next door, plenty of restaurants and bars in the immediate vicinity, across the road from the subway and a 10 minute walk to the centre of SOHO. One gripe I would make is that the bar is very expensive, but so was NYC on the whole. We ventured up to the bar one evening for a pre meal drink and got told it was closed for a private function. The hotel is also quite noisy...you can hear the noise of the bar upstairs, and the walls are so thin that you can hear reception giving next door a wake up call!! I would not recommend this hotel for NYC first timers, but instead for those who want to avoid the tourist traps and opt for chilling out in the bohemian surroundings of the LES.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary experience”
Reviews.Author: rogerad
Reviews.Content: I recently went for an extended stay in NYC for business. After a week, my partner joined me, we moved together uptown. I wished I had stayed put. I had stayed at other Thompson hotels, and LES is my favorite. The staff went out of their way to make my visit extraordinary. My Studio King Suite was impeccably clean, comfortable - and the rain shower was just out of this world. The area is terrific. I know NYC well, and I found staying in this are to be fun - thrilling. Most of my business was midtown, and plenty of taxis were available and the "F" train conveniently across the street. About a block away there was a huge Whole Foods Market - and at the corner a gem of a deli called Sugar where I could get my morning bagel. I cannot say enough about the staff. And the restaurant - SHANG - is the best! I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: trvlr76
Reviews.Content: Let me say we got a great deal for a King suite at 166 a night, with a restaurant credit. The location is unbeatable. There are great cafes and bars all around. Check in was easy, and the staff was great. I requested a room on a higher floor, and had to wait until about 4 to get in. The room was nice, very modern looking. The beds are a nightmare. I think Europeans, like my husband, are used to sleeping on VERY firm mattresses, but I am not. The linens included no flat sheet, just a comforter. My husband is used to this, I thought it was a nightmare, as I was always either too hot or cold. The view was nice, with floor to ceiling windows. The lights are on dimmers, and take some fumbling to get them working. The minibar is well stocked. Breakfast in the hotel is subpar, and expensive. Go somewhere else. The restaurant is nice looking, but service stinks, and the food is mediocre at best. Here come the concerning parts. Our second night, my husband's key stopped working, so he stopped at the front desk to get a new one. It was about midnight, and the receptionist was on a personal call, took his key, asked what room number, and just reprogrammed it. She did not ask for his ID, or even his name. He could have found that key on the street! Our room was never cleaned. We arrived on a Thurs. Fri, we left the room at noon, and came back at 7, to a dirty room. We figured we may have missed the cleaning window, so we didn't complain. Sat, we left at 8, and came back at 6, to a dirty room. We called down to complain, and ask for at least some new towels. The irony, the minibar was magically checked and restocked each day. Hmmm. That Sat night, we made it an early night, and around 10:30 pm, someone tried to get in our room, using a key. They knocked, but did not announce who they were. I cannot fathom ANY reason a staff member would be in a guests' room at that hour! Checkout was quick, though they made a mistake with the bill. The hotel is just okay, but with the subpar service, I would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ZiaLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Thompson LES with a friend in a king suite. The room was beautiful, with the bed being the most comfortable thing I have ever slept in, The rooms were beautifully cleaned each day, and chocolates left for us on our return. The room and hotel as a whole were stylish and immaculate. The only flaw was the restaurant. We ate there one night, and whilst the waiting staff could not be criticised, neither myself or my friend enjoyed the food we had. There are a range of bars, and we used th pool a few mornings and had it completely to ourselves. The hotel is close to a number of subway lines, and many bars and restaurants. I would highly recommend it. Not cheap but definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: FunintheBigCity
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here, the first was just after it opened in '08 and there were a few issues but this time things have certainly gotten ironed out. The location is away from the normal tourist spots of Central Park, Times Sq, 5th Ave etc but where the LES is located is just great. One block away from the Subway and therefore not really that far from the tourist spots BUT you are just a few minutes away from other great areas such as SOHO, Tribeca, Chinatown, etc. The area may be a little "rough" around the edges but you get a realistic New York experience. The staff are fantastic, always greeting you on arrival and go out of their way to help you. Their restaurant recommendations are terrific, and there are plenty to choose from. The rooms are large for Manhattan with floor to ceiling glass affording you great views. I guess if I was quibbling I could say the iPod dock/ music system could be a little better and may be a few more choices on the TV channels but that is about it. The rooms are immaculate and beds supremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: HildegardBerlin
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Thompson LES. The rooms are nicely decorated and the bath room big and beautiful. I also liked the products from Kiehl's. The location of the hotel is fantastic. There is so much variety regarding restaurants and bars! I also thouight that the hotel staff was very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location with great rooms with the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: kimmi8
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel to NYC, I stay in the LES or SoHo. It's easy to get to all the happening bars and shopping. The Thompson LES is in a great, great location in the heart of the LES and close to subway lines that take you to SoHo or downtown. There are plenty of restaurants and shops all around. That was the best part of staying at this hotel. We were upgraded to a large corner suite which was huge in comparison to other NYC hotels. Everything was clean with modern furnishings, floor to ceiling windows, large bathrooms with rainshower and a huge deck with tables and sunchairs. The furnishings while modern were done in cheap materials but hey, that's what you get from boutique hotels. The A/C made a bit of noise at night but it wasn't too much of a bother for us. I've heard though that the standard rooms can be kind of small. The restaurant was terrible. Asian fusion at it's worse. There's too much good food outside, don't eat in the hotel. The "members only" club has seen better days despite it not being open for that long. When we walked through, the place looked tore up and filled with drunk, frat boys. Again, go outside if you want a NYC scene. Room service at night is very minimal and they order from a local restaurant. You're better off again, venturing outside. :)

Reviews.Title: “great location; pretty great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zsuzu
Reviews.Content: The summary: the hotel and room were clean, the bed comfy, the room was large and quiet by NYC standards, the staff were very helpful and service focused, and the location is good. I will definitely consider staying here again on my next trip to NYC. The hotel is located just below Houston St (so at the top of the lower east side within easy walking distance of the east village, SOHO, Nolita etc). I booked my room through an on-line seller and got a good rate and a $100 credit for the restaurant so great value for money. While trendy in dÃ©cor and clearly trying to be a hot spot the hotel is attracting a wide variety of guests and the staff provided good service â€“ often trendy hot spot hotels can have snotty service and attract only hipster guests â€“ not the case here. Check-in was efficient and friendly as was check-out. Concierge services were helpful and high quality. When I checked in well into the evening I had to ask to have the bedding changed as I hadnâ€™t informed the hotel ahead of my feather allergy and housekeeping came up immediately and dealt with it. Whenever I ran into housekeeping staff during my visit they were friendly and efficient. Three warnings. First, the room heating and cooling system in my room was located right near the bed and the fan blows at the bed. For me this was fine as I sleep best with some white noise and donâ€™t mind air movement. I mention this as I have friends for whom I know this would be an issue - if it would be for you, you might want to inquire about room configurations when booking. Second, the location was great for me since it was located in amongst some of my favourite parts of NYC in lower manhattan. If you are looking for the luxury NYC experience you may not be comfortable with neighbourhood which is certainly grittier than the hotel heavy area just south of central park or the upper east or west sides. Third, the hotel is currently brand new and I think some of the finishes may not hold up well under constant use (for example the bathroom counter-top is already showing some minor signs of water damage) so Iâ€™d be interested in hearing about the condition of the rooms in another couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a visit to the East Village or Soho”
Reviews.Author: DSchwab
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for my daughter's graduation from NYU and because she lives in the East Village. Great location for wandering in that neighborhood or down into Soho. I got a $160 night rate for a Queen room, so it was reasonably priced. The room was small, but well appointed. I would have helped if they had a luggage stand for my bag, but we got over that and just worked out of the bag on the floor. There were only a couple of petty annoyances, one was the 9am test of the fire alarm. We did have to call down to the front desk to make sure there wasn't a real emergency, and the other was making note, because of the alarm, that the fire alarm/smoke detector in the bathroom still had it's pre-construction covering on it, which made it inoperable, just in case there had been a fire in the bathroom. The continental breakfast was haphazard with some fruit and bagels laid out on a table like it was for unexpected guests. Room service would probably be a better choice. Overall, I liked the place, the people seemed helpful and friendly to us and we liked the location for a leisure visit to the lower city.

Reviews.Title: “Could be great”
Reviews.Author: GlobalH
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a king room on 3rd floor. Room was very well appointed for the price. Bathrooms modern and clean, great shower! Room service comes from "Shang" restaurant downstairs. It is expensive but very good! Bar scene is fairly 'happening' and all very 'cool'. Location is just a little too far from Broadway to take a quick easy walk, but not too bad. Bellhops were friendly and helpful. Front desk staff were like robots. No life in them at all. They seem either desperately unhappy or were trying to seem way too cool. A hello and good bye would help in converstations. After asking for directions I received an uninformed and vague answer and then the front desk guy just walked away. I thought he was going to get me more information, but he then started 'serving' another guest at the desk. It was quite awkward. There were no welcomes or farewells at check in and check out. It was all so sombre. Some communication skills and some genuine hospitality would bring this hotel into the league i assume it aspires to be in. The truth is that I would have come back to stay there again right up until I paid my bill and checked out. It was then I think that I gave up on the place.The front desk man barely grunted at me, took my money and without another word walked away into the back office door . No one said good bye so I flagged down a cab and headed to the airport. Plenty of other places to stay when I return to the city in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: medulla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed on room 1103. We got a special promo rate of roughly $166 a night for a Studio King Suite. It was a total steal! The room was well designed, modern, sexy, super spacious, and the lighting was fantastic. I don't understand what the other comments were complaining about it being too dark, there are dimmers to all the lights and you can dial them up pretty bright. The temperature was perfect and we heard nothing, no noise at all... we slept like logs every night. The linens were very comfortable, and everything was super clean. My husband and I absolutely loved our room and would stay there again in a heartbeat. The front desk was very friendly and helpful, when we pulled up to the hotel in a cab, they ran outside to help us with our bags. We were greeted by all every time we walked in and out of the lobby. One down side is that Wifi will cost you $10/day. All things aside, the location alone is worth every penny. The lower east side is very cool and not commercialized at all. The hotel is literally steps away from the city's coolest bars, vintage shops, independent boutiques, etc. I think if you like the lower east side, you will like this hotel. It's no Sheraton... and the lower east side is certainly no Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Special evening underwhelming room”
Reviews.Author: travelalala
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? We were offered to pay $150 to upgrade to a king suite room, which were told would still be 50% of the regular price of that room. We took it, figuring why not it was my husband's bday and we were just staying over night and enjoying a chance to sleep in while our sitter watched our two little ones. The room was nicely furnished, quite big, but for a hotel that's not that old we were surprised at small wear and tear already like rubber stripping hanging off the balcony door, a loose towel rack hook by the shower, and plumbing pipes made a horribly loud noise for a solid 15 seconds every time you ran the faucet or flushed the toilet. Other complaints about the room were that half the closet doors were blocked by a nightstand and there were two flat screen tvs back to back - one to watch from bed and one to watch from the couch - which weren't working and required a few calls to maintenance. Service-wise the room was only set up for one person in terms of towels and robes, there were no toiletries at all in the tub/shower (just a bar of soap at the sink), a card addressed to another guest had been left in our room, and it took 20 minutes and 2 phone calls to have a bucket of ice delivered to chill some champagne we had brought with us (this was after we'd made the request at the front desk during check-in). I have heard great things about the new restaurant, Shang, but we didn't try it out since we already had dinner reservations elsewhere. I would not though recommend the overpriced room service coffee, which was weak and cost $20 when you added in the required tax/tips.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be all things to all people”
Reviews.Author: PVH1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights, original booking was for a Studio King Suite on a deal of $166 per night + $100 dollar credit for Shang restaurant, can't complain at these prices, but I would complain if I was paying much more!! E-mailed ahead to ask for a high floor quiet room, on arrival we were allocated a 6th floor room. Young, slightly aloof receptionist tried to sell us an upgrade to a Thompson Suite on same floor for an additional $50 per night by talking down the Studio King, we viewed both and didn't think it was worth the extra. Staff obviously pressured to make the hard sell in these credit crunch times. Room was spacious, clean, well kitted out but a bit gloomy and dark. Street noise was a problem, so next morning we again requested a high floor. Very helpful guy on reception was moving us to the 14th floor when the original check-in girl from previous day became involved and suddenly only a 9th floor room was available, we were not thrilled but reminded ourselves that we were on a good deal and let it pass. 9th floor was a definite improvement & the new room (a double, double), was quieter & brighter with a better view. A word of warning & to echo the previous poster, I heard numerous people complaining about the noise from the 7th floor bar, in particular a receptionist telling a guest that their were no other rooms available & they would ask the DJ to turn down the bass the next night!! I suspect if you're in a front room on the 8th floor you won't get much sleep at night, fine if you're a party animal, less so if you're not. This I think is the Thompson LES's dilemma, it's a big investment & needs the revenue from all areas, unfortunately this may be at the expense of some of it's other guests. There are many good qualities about this hotel and the rooms are of a high standard but the overall experience just leaves you cold. It's just too cool for school & want's you to know it! We ate in Shang on a Monday night & found it to be a shambles, we waited 15 minutes for menus & 45 minutes to place our order, only managing this by placing it with the celeb chef as he exchanged pleasantries with us! The Singapore Slaw & Sashimi starters were outstanding, we found the main courses & overall service to be mediocre. We loved the area, loads of local bars, cafes & restaurants , try SimonSips just over the road on 1st Street for the best breakfast cappucino & granola we found! Would we return to the Thompson LES? Unless it was another great deal - probably not. No way is it worth anywere near full price in the new post credit crunch world order, it was built in the boom and I think it's going to struggle now we're in the bust.

Reviews.Title: “Just doesn't cut it”
Reviews.Author: DaveSnood
Reviews.Content: First of all when staying at the hotel do not stay on the eigth floor as there is a club below and your room rumbles to the bass of the club and u may as well go down to the bar because the noise is the same as if you were at the club. The service staff are less than friendly and seem to be very young and inexperienced. The rooms are very dark and it is difficult to see things. The elevators are terrible and you can not see the floor buttons because of mood lighting gone bad. You also have to use your card everytime you are in the elevator and you have no time if you are on the third or fourth floor. The lobby is cold and less than comfortable especially when they leave you waiting as the housekeeping staff fall behind.

Reviews.Title: “My current favorite hotel in the Lower East Side”
Reviews.Author: DrivenByJanice
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very clean. They even fold my clothes for me. The rooms and design are very clean and modern. Best location in LES. 8 blocks to SOHO. A hop skip and jump to the East Village bars and restaurants. I stayed here for 9 nights on business and wouldn't hesitate to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “More Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: nycvisitor214
Reviews.Content: other places looked at staying were The W, the ritz carlton, radison, the hilton. Upon arrival, i was greeted on a first name basis, they had been expecting me. my flight arrived very early, and the room wasnt supposed to be ready until checkin time. i was put into a room 5 hours earlier than was supposed to be, and more importantly, i was given a room which i had requested but was undecided about, since this was a very important date, valentines day, this was a deal breaker. the room was big, very nice and comfortable queen size bed, very clean, had amnenties that most other uber expensive hotels did not offer, bathroom in all black slate, with flosted glass, ie huge tub, big shower room. the staff was friendly and was a great help on the dining suggestion given. upon leaving i was helped in keeping my bags, longer than the check out, as how my flight was delayed. the price was great, and i believe what i paid was far less than i should have. 2 night stay was 560, and given other stays around the world, i loved it, already have a stay booked for july 4th wkend, it helps i received an offer for complementary stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable rate for a really nice hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: PAMomanddaughter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel over the last weekend in February. Got one regular room and one suite, the prices were incredible through Quikbook ($150 for a king bed suite with a pull out double couch and $120 for a queen bed regular room). I don't remember ever paying that little for rooms in NY and remember getting really awful rooms for $300 a night in midtown. The hotel is, as my husband put it, "groovy". Very modern and "stylin", typical NY. But also really nice, clean, nice soaps and shampoos, comfortable. For us the location was perfect. We also fit 4 college students plus my son, whose show we went to see, and one friend into the suite and the hotel knew we had too many people and just said nothing. They were so friendly and the service was amazing. My daughter and her friends had bought a pint of ice cream and called for spoons which were promptly delivered and later a blanket for the extra bed which came up immediately. We had breakfast at the restaurant since there were seven of us and we didn't want to try to fit in somewhere as many of the restaurants and cafes in the area are small. It was delicious, with a beautiful buffet and a great menu. Not cheap but it was worth it so we could all eat together and the room is really nice and light with lots of windows and nice muted colors (big orange lantern type lights, very tasteful). We were only blocks from the little theater we were going to, and ate dinner at a fantastic ethiopian restaurant a couple of blocks away. Transportation is very convenient. Oh and we had amazing views of the city on our side. It was a bit noisy as we were over a club which played til about 2 am, but we were up til about 1:15 anyway. As it was a Friday night, I don't know what that's like during the week. My daughter was in the back which was quiet. At this price, I would stay here over and over and even when it gets more expensive, I'd return. I'd pay double the price per room and more but happily, so far, the price is amazing. There were plenty of people in the place and the bar seemed to have people in it as well, so they may raise the price soon. If you are going to NY and don't mind staying on the lower east side, or even prefer it, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: acooton
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a TV crew. Perfect location to be in the neighbourhoods and out of the hustle bustle of Mid Town. Rooms are delicious and wonderful toiletries. Food is very expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for location”
Reviews.Author: pzs200la
Reviews.Content: stayed here twice in january. once had a very small room on 12th floor, then a nicer room on 16th. Both rooms were the queen/king sized superior rooms. I assumed the smaller room on the 12th was just a design quirk, but I am sure there other rooms of that size. Also, I had some small issues with a draft coming from outside. But as long as you kept the heat on in the room (which you needed since it's pretty cold in nyc during january) you did not feel it. The service and staff was great. The previous comments about a minimalist feel to the rooms is correct. The bathrooms were very clean and comfortable. But since this is new york city, you need to expect the rooms to be small, but the beds were comfortable and you had some great views. I would recommend staying on higher floors since allen street is a busy one. But there are great restaurants around there and you are a 5-10 minute walk from chinatown, little italy, soho, and close to many subway stops. I booked the rooms at quikbook, so I got great rates. Don't know if I would pay full price for the rooms, but that's more a reflection of my budget. I imagine it will be quite popular in the summer with the outdoor pool and bar. The exercise room was adequate but small.
